loans.name: Erdenesuren

texts.en:
Mr.Erdenesuren is 56 years old, and lives with his wife in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Surenjav, is 55 and works at the state library as a librarian. 

He has helped his son run his business (a retail toy store) in a rental counter at the local market. He has gained much experience in dealing with customers and suppliers over the years. 

He is now planning to start his own business (curtain retailing) in the local market. He is requesting 2,000,000MNT to purchase a starting inventory for his business. 

He is a hardworking, responsible, and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase a starting inventory for his curtain retail business.

loans.name: Purna Chandra

texts.en:
Purna Chandra is a 49-year-old differently-able person living with his wife and a child in the village of Puri, a sacred place, in Odisha, India. He owns and manages a small fruit stall in a market near his village. He sells apples, oranges, bananas, grapes and other seasonal fruits from his stall. He earns 9,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this business, which is not sufficient for his family.

Purna Chandra has a plan to expand his shop by renovating it and keeping more stock of seasonal fruits in the shop. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to do this. He wants to save some money for future unfortunates.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seasonal fruits like apples, oranges, bananas, grapes, etc., for his fruit stall.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 37 years old. She sells charcoal and vegetables, and she has been in this business for three years. She is married, and blessed with four children. Three of them are enrolled in school. 

She wants this loan to buy more charcoal and vegetables to resell. She will reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий – из села Водяное. Он проживает там с супругой и двумя взрослыми детьми. Василий занимается выращиванием ранних овощей, помидор и редиса. Он имеет большой участок земли, на котором держит три большие теплицы и еще две теплицы для рассады. 

Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту Василий подготовился к сезону и получил хорошу прибыль. Часть прибыли Василий вложил в бизнес и купил котел для отопления. Сейчас ему нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы купить и провести трубы для отопления теплиц и купить мотор.

Внуку Василия (ему 4 годика) недавно сделали операцию. Все прошло успешно, ребенок уже здоров.
texts.en:
Vasiliy is from the village of Vodyanoe, where he lives with his wife and two adult children. He grows early vegetables, tomatoes, and radishes. He owns a large plot of land, where he maintains three large greenhouses and two other greenhouses for transplanting. 

Thanks to his previous Kiva loan, Vasiliy was well prepared for his season and made a good profit. He invested a part of the profit in his business by purchasing a boiler for heating his greenhouse. Now he needs some additional funds to purchase and install pipes for the heating system and to purchase a motor. 

Vasiliy's 4-year-old granddaughter recently underwent an operation. Everything went well and she has already recovered.

loans.use: to purchase pipes for heating his greenhouse and a motor

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru: Раиса выращивает овощи в теплицах. Она использовала кредит для того, чтобы сделать отопление на теплицу, а также сделать двойную пленку (дополнительную защиту от морозов), чтобы начать торговать пораньше по более выгодным ценам. Благодаря полученным доходам Раиса помогла сыну купить небольшой дом. Рядом с домом была старая теплица. Раиса с сыном сломали ее и на этом месте хотят построить новую. Для этого Раиса просит предоставить ей кредит 17,000 гривен.
texts.en:
Raisa grows vegetables in her greenhouse. She used a previous loan to install a heating system and a double layer of plastic sheeting, which provides extra protection against frost, in her greenhouse. She did all of this in order to be able to start selling earlier at more competitive prices. 

Thanks to the extra income from her previous loan, Raisa was able to buy her son a small home. There was an old greenhouse near the home. She and her son torn it down and now want to build a new one on the property. Hence, Raisa is requesting a 17,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to build a large, new greenhouse

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.ru:
Николай занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке уже 5 лет. В основном он выращивает помидоры, редис и огурцы. Он живет в Каменке, в своем доме. 

Осенью от сильного ветра повредилась пленка на теплице. Ее нужно менять. Никоалй просит дать ему кредит 24,000 гривен. Кроме замены пленки Николай хочет увеличить размер теплицы и доделать отопление. 

Никоалй помогает своей дочери и ее мужу осваивать тепличный бизнес.
texts.en: Nikolay has grown vegetables on his land for five years now. He mainly grows tomatoes, radishes, and cucumbers. He lives in Kamenka in his own home. In the fall, strong wind damaged the covering on his greenhouse and now he needs to replace it. Hence, Nikolay is requesting a 24,000 hryvnia loan. Additionally, he would like to increase the size of his greenhouse and add heating. He is currently helping his daughter and her husband learn the greenhouse business.

loans.use: to replace the covering on and complete the heating in his greenhouse.

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
Alejandrina es uno de los miembros del  grupo Trabajando en Armonía

Alejandrina tiene 52 años, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de  confitería y helados, su pequeño negocio lo ha instalado en su casa donde tiene una vitrina con los productos que vende, en algunas oportunidades también sale a las calles a ofrecerlos, gracias a su trabajo ella puede ayudar en la manutención de su familia, sobretodo apoyar con los estudios de sus hijos; su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque camina mucho, son 12 horas diarias las que le dedica a su trabajo, fue su suegra quien le enseño a preparar los confites  que son muy ricos, sus fieles compradores son niños, transportistas y público en general. Alejandrina utilizara el dinero de su préstamo para comprar helados y los ingredientes para la seguir trabajando.
Alejandrina se siente feliz de que otras personas puedan ayudarla a ella y su grupo, agradece a KIVA por permitirles progresar y ser mejores personas, en la foto es la primera de la izquierda (en la parte de atrás) viste pantalón color celeste.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the group "Trabajando en Armonía" [Working in Harmony] and is 52 years old.  She is married (common-law) and has 4 children.  Alejandrina works selling candies and ice cream.  She has set up her small business in her house where she has a glass display of the products she sells.  Sometimes she also offers them as a street vendor.

Thanks to her work she can help support her family; more than anything help with the schooling of her children.  She sacrifices much for her work because she walks a lot and dedicates 12 hours a day to her work.  

She was taught how to make sweets by her mother-in-law, which are very good.  Her faithful customers are children, transportation workers, and the public in general.

Alejandrina will use this loan to buy ice cream and ingredients to make the sweets she sells and keep working.

Alejandrina is happy that other people are helping her and her group.  She is thankful to Kiva for allowing them to progress and be better people.  In this photo she is the first one on the left (towards the back) in the light blue pants.

loans.use: buy candy and ice cream ingredients

loans.name: Yajaira Celina

texts.es: Yajaira de 38 años de edad, originaria de la Comarcas las Banderas, en las afueras de Teustepe, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 8, 13 y 14 años, actualmente los 3 están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio su actividad laboral con capital propio, dinero que tenia ahorrado, cuando comenzó con su negocio no vendía mucho productos, luego con el tiempo fue invirtiendo cada centavo que hacia en la pulpería, fue asi que  poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ventas. Busco financiamiento para poder agregar otros productos que no tenían en inventario y que eran muy solicitados por sus clientes. Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque fue adquiriendo más clientela, con lo que ha podido obtener más ingresos. Se acerca la temporada escolar y es por eso que esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, mochila,  borrador, reglas, etc. sus planes futuros es ampliar su pulpería.
texts.en: 38 year old Yajaira is from Comarcas las Banderas in the outskirts of Teustepe. She is married, and is the mother of 3 children between the ages of 8, 13, and 14 years. They are all currently in school. She is in business and is the owner of a grocery store. She started her business with her own capital, money that she had saved. When she opened the store, she didn't sell many products. Later, with time, she invested every cent that she had in the store and, little by little, her sales increased. She is seeking a loan so that she can add other products that she hasn't had before, and that are often requested by her customers, to her inventory. She feels very satisfied as she has been gaining more customers and so she has been able to earn more income. The school year is nearly here, and this is why she is requesting the loan to buy school supplies such as notebooks, ballpoint pens, backpacks, erasers, rulers, etc. Her future plan is to grow her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as notebooks, ballpoint pens, backpacks, erasers, rulers, etc.

loans.name: S Sudarsan

texts.en: S. Sudarsan is a physically challenged person, age 33. He lives with his wife and his only child, who is in school. He manages a betel-cum-variety shop in his village. He sells betel; packaged foods, like biscuits, cake, etc.; soap of different brands; detergent; shampoo; talc powder; face wash; body lotion; etc. Because there is only one variety shop in his village, all the villagers depend on his shop for their daily necessities, but he is not able to fulfill all his customers' demands. S. Sudarsan requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more stock of what he sells now and a few more new products like cooking oil, lentils, noodles, etc. He hopes to make his family happy and to provide a better education for his child by sending him to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase betel, biscuits, oil, lentils, noodles, talcum powder, detergents, etc., for his variety store.

loans.name: Maryori Madeleine

texts.es:
Maryori es una joven de 20 años, muy alegre y carismática y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad de cálido clima y posee playas hermosas las cuales son muy visitadas por muchos turistas. Ella es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tal es así que trabaja desde muy joven y a pesar de las adversidades logro estudiar una carrera universitaria. Maryori también es una joven con talentos artísticos, tal es así que actualmente gracias a su bella voz ella trabaja en un conjunto musical, especialmente en un grupo de mariachis y con los frutos de su trabajo puede apoyar a su familia, ella trabaja principalmente los fines de semana en matrimonios, cumpleaños y otras actividades, ella cree que está saliendo adelante ya que le gusta lo que hace y porque es muy responsable.

Maryori está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, entre otros para poder realizar refacciones en las paredes de su vivienda, así ella podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en:
Maryori is a young woman of 20 years of age. She is very cheerful and charismatic and, above, really wants to get ahead. She lives in the city of Carmana, a city with a warm climate that has beautiful beaches that attract many tourists. She is a young woman who wants to succeed, so much so that she has worked since she was very young and, in spite of adversity, was able to attend university. Maryori is also a young woman with artistic talent, so much so that, currently, thanks to her beautiful voice, she is working in a musical group, a mariachi band. With the fruits of her labor, she can support her family. She works mostly at the weekend for weddings, birthdays, and other events. She believes that she is getting ahead because the customers like what she does and because she is very responsible. 
Maryori is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support they have offered, she will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and more to make repairs to her parents house. In this way, she will be able to improve the family's standard of living and to continue striving to realize her greatest dream: to have her own business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 28 years old. She sells various items in her business. She has been in the business for the past three years. She wants a loan, to buy more sugar and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Christian Jesus

texts.es:
Christian tiene 21 años es estudiante de Derecho en una universidad local
Christian escogió esta carrera por vocación ya que siempre se intereso por los derechos de las personas, ya lleva estudiando 4 años de los cuales le falta un año y medio para culminar su carrera, en sus horas libres trabaja como comerciante para ayudarse con la compra de materiales y libros que requiere su profesión, en el ínterin de su carrera, el obstáculo mayor es la parte económica que muchas veces lo ha desanimado, felizmente es su hijo quien lo alienta a seguir con sus propósitos y es el motivo principal para convertirse en un buen profesional, con el dinero de su préstamo podrá pagar las mensualidades de 02 ciclos en la universidad, también está buscando realizar sus practican en algún estudio jurídico lo que espera concretar muy pronto.
Christian quiere agradecer a los Inversionistas de KIVA por apoyarlo en su objetivo de convertirse en una mejor persona y un profesional prestigioso.
texts.en:
21 year-old Christian is a law student at a local university.
Christian sees this career as a vocation as he has always been interested in the people's rights. He has been studying for 4 years and has a year and a half left of his course. In his free time, he works in business to help him buy the materials and books that are required for his profession. The biggest obstacle to his career is the economic part, which has often left him discouraged. Happily, it is his son who encourages him to pursue his goals and who is his main motivation to become a good professional. He will use the money from the loan to make the monthly payments for 2 cycles in the university. He is also seeking a position in a law firm, and expect that to happen very soon.
Christian wants to thank the KIVA lenders for supporting him in his goal to become a better person and a prestigious professional.

loans.use: to make monthly payments.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs.Ganchimeg is 30 years old and lives with her husband in a small house, in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She runs a butcher shop with her husband, Monhbaatar, at a rental counter of the local market. Ganchimeg and her husband have been in the butcher shop business for two years. They purchase meat and cattle from herders in the countryside, and sell to local customers at their counter.

They need their own vehicle, to reduce their transportation costs. Now Ganchimeg is requesting to borrow 4,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car, to run their business with higher efficiency. Both borrower and her husband are hard-working and open-minded people.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car, to run their business with greater efficiency

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 35 years old and a farmer in Kisii county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and four children. Three of her children have started schooling. She has been farming for the past fifteen years producing milk, maize and beans which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting for 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that will provide her with more milk for sale and earn her extra income. She will use this income to improve her living standards and pay for her children’s schooling. She aspires to buy another dairy cow in the next five years.

Fluctuation of prices and too much rainfall are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan is a Roma man in his late thirties and he is married with two children. They live within their community in a central city in Albania. 

The loan that Luan is requesting is his first one. With this he wants to buy used items to resell. Buying & reselling second-hand items is something that he has been doing for almost seven years. 

“The majority of people in our city are poor, and buying new and trendy items from the stores is almost impossible for them. Thus, they come to us; buying more items at a lower price. They can afford this, of course. We are happy and they are happy! It works excellent for both parties,” Luan said.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to resell

loans.name: Surrayia's Group

texts.en:
Ms.Surriya is a 36 year old woman. Her husband is a taxi driver and she is the mother of 3 sons and 3 daughters. 

She is a very hard working tailor by profession and has excellent skills in stitching female clothing. Due to financial issues, she has started her tailoring business by purchasing a sewing machine. Since 2005 Surriya has been operating this business very efficiently. She is interested in expanding her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. Surriya, as a member of 3-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

She is hopeful that the loan will help her to increase her net income and savings.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs.Gantsetseg is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in a small house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband Myagmarbaatar is 36 years old and runs a small animal pelt retail business in a local market. Zagadzusem, age 15 and Tsend-Ayush, age 10 go to local schools. Her twin sons Tormonh and Monhtor are 2 years old and go to local kindergarten. The borrower has been working as a saleswoman in a local market for 12 years and now she is planning to start her own butcher shop at a rented counter of the local market. She is now requesting 3,000,000MNT to purchase meat products for her butcher shop. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase meat products for her newly started butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú,  les presento  a un grupo conformado por 10 integrantes  con gran iniciativa para los negocios, así se caracteriza el grupo comunal “Libertadores”. Una de  los integrantes  es la Sra. Ana de 52 años de edad  y madre de 3 hijo, el cual son  su  motivo de superación diaria, la Sra. Ana desde muy temprano  se dedica a la venta  de verduras  que vende en un pequeño mercado. Para  así poder salir  adelante y prosperar como pequeña comerciante. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de verduras tales como papa lechuga y otros tubérculos,  para su posterior venta. La Sra. Ana está muy contenta  por el préstamo otorgado y agrádese  el interés brindado y la confianza que han depositado en ella, deja la promesa de seguir superándose para mejorar la calidad de vida  de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru! I present to you a loan group comprised of 10 members who have great business initiative. This how is the community group Libertadores can be described. One of the members is 52 year old Ana, mother of 3 children who are her main motivation to succeed every day. Ana has been selling vegetables for a long time and she sells them in the little market. In this way, she can get ahead and prosper as a small-businesswoman. She will use the loan to buy vegetables such as potatoes, lettuces, and other tubers and she will sell them later. Ana is very happy with the loan awarded to her and the interest that is offered and the confidence that has been placed in her. She makes a promise to continue overcoming difficulties to improve the quality of life for her and for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potatoes, lettuce, and other tubers.

loans.name: Delio

texts.en: Delio is a 44-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has six young children. He is into fishing. He catches fish, crabs, shrimps and sea shells. He has been in the fishing business for 15 years. Delio requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fishing materials like fishnets, crab nets and fuel for his motorboat, which is very helpful for his fishing activity as his source of livelihood. Delio works hard to support his family. In the future, Delio would like to invest in other ventures in order to save as well as to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishnets, crab nets and fuel for his motorboat

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is in his early 60s and a Roma man, who was widowed nearly twenty years ago, when his only child was two-and-a-half years old. Bajram lived and worked in Greece for almost 10 years, accompanied by his son. For the most recent ten years, they both have been living in their city in south-central Albania, in their community.

Bajram has been offering transportation services to members of his community, with his own cart and horses. “It has been profitable, and I have been enjoying this activity, too. It’s beautiful!  It’s kind of traditional in our Romani community,” Bajram said. 

“For all these past years, my only goal was to raise my son, and now that I feel I have accomplished that, I'd like to improve our living conditions. It’s about time, yet I know that I can’t achieve this without lenders' support,” he ended his conversation.

loans.use: To make repairs to the family home

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is a mother of five children, ages seven to twelve. Two of them are adopted. And they all go to school. She sells foodstuffs, and she has spent eight years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more foods to resell, like potatoes, rice and maize flour. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more foods to resell, like potatoes, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Juan Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 43 años de edad, pero tiene la alegría y el espíritu de un joven de 20 años, el vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, y también podemos apreciar una gastronomía variada en especial uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “Chupe de camarones”. Sixto aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven ya que  sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria.

Día a día Sixto trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, con su trabajo puede solventar los gastos propios del hogar  con mucho esfuerzo, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 cliente diariamente; él cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.

Sixto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá   comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, hormigón, arena, entre otros  con lo cual podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda  como refacción de paredes, mejoramiento de pisos y tuberías, así podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de transportes”.
texts.en:
Sixto is 43 years old, but he has the joy and spirt of a young man of 20. He lives in the city of Camaná, which is characterized by its warm a welcoming climate. There is a lot of agriculture here, particularly the cultivation of rice, and we can also appreciate the varied food. In particular, one of the favorite dishes of the area is the delicious shrimp soup. Sixto learned to work when he was very young as his parents had few economic resources and, because of this, he was only able to study up to the 5th grade of secondary school. 
Day in and day out, Sixto works as a motorcycle-taxi driver. Working hard at this job enables him to cover the household expenses. He works about 10 hours a day and may have 15 customers a day. He believes that he is doing well in his work because he is responsible and friendly to his customers. 
Sixto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, concrete, sand, and other things with which he will make improvements to his home such as repairing the walls, and improving the floors and plumbing. In this way, he will be able to have a better quality of life and continue fighting to achieve his greatest dream: to have a transportation business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a cow for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Anita's Group

texts.en:
Anita lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 36 years old, an independent woman. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a government employee. Since 2005, Anita has been running her beauty salon. She has excellent beautician skills. She conducts this business in one room of her house. She needs to buy cosmetic products, including makeup kits, hair dryers and facial creams.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, as a member of a six-person borrowing group. She is hopeful that the loan will bring out a positive change in her income. She is thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cake making and decorating equipment

loans.name: Shingirirai Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-year-old Stella from Masvingo. She is married and has six children. For the past 15 years, Stella has run a food business selling beef. She says that her main challenge is periods when business is generally low. Stella has requested a loan of 1,000 USD to buy beasts for slaughtering. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay fees and to buy food for her grandchildren. In the future, Stella wishes to buy a truck for easy transportation of beasts.

loans.use: To buy beasts for slaughtering

loans.name: Astrit

texts.en:
Astrit is 49 and lives in central Albania with his wife. For ten years now, Astrit has been doing woodworking and the clientele he has managed to build is stable and wide. “There is a lack of such services in my region, and this works perfectly in my end; more clients, more work for me. Yet, I do not take advantage; I still try to offer my very best services and quality as well as keep my clientele happy,” Astrit said.

Astrit is requesting a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek which he will use to purchase wooden planks and machinery for his shop.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks and machinery for his shop.

loans.name: Ricarte

texts.en:
Ricarte is a happy person, which is good for attracting costumers for his beauty salon business. Ricarte offers hair cutting, straightening, and some hair styling. (He also offers catering for all occasions.)  He has learned this type of business working for someone who has a beauty salon.

Ricarte has the passion to succeed. He is a helpful person, who always thinks about a better way of living of his parent, brothers and sisters as well. Ricarte’s customers encourage him to offer hair coloring. Hence, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy hair spa and hair coloring requisites.

 He hopes to continue to manage the business well and to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy hair spa and hair coloring requisites.

loans.name: Judhistira

texts.en:
Judhistira is a 43-year-old physically challenged person living with his wife and three children in a village of Odisha. He has a vegetable shop in his village where he sells parwal, brinjal (egg plant), cabbage, cauliflower, lady finger [okra], cucumber, tomato, bitter gourd, etc. He has been involved in this business since 2003. He purchases the vegetables twice a week from the local market, which is nine kilometres from his village. In this way, he earns 5,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from his business. The village people are benefited by purchasing vegetables from his shop, as there is no other vegetable shop in the village. He wants to expand his business by renovating his shop and adding a larger quantity of seasonal vegetables and, along with it, he also wants to add fruits as well.

Judhistira has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase these products and renovate his shop so that he can meet the customers' demand. He will be able to earn 7,000 to 8,000 INR a month from this business. He has a dream to make a house for his family and give his children the best education.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing vegetables like parwal, brinjal (eggplant), cabbage, cauliflower, lady finger [okra], etc., and for renovating his vegetable shop.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan is 21-year-old student from Yerevan. He studies at Mkhitar Heratsi Yerevan State Medical University, in the economics department. Stepan lives with his mother, sister and older brother. Together with her children, Stepan's mother works hard to sustain her family and to cover her children's basic needs. She works as a teacher, but unfortunately her monthly income is enough only to make ends meet. So it is very hard for her to save money for Stepan's education. Stepan has applied for this loan to pay for university tuition. The loan is very important for him to complete his education and become a good economist.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Gezim

texts.en:
Gezim is in his early sixties, married, and has three grown-up children. They all live in a suburb of a major city in the southwestern part of Albania where members of their Egyptian community live. He works hard to support his wife as well, since she has been paralyzed for a very long time.
Gezim repairs shoes, and he offers his services to everyone, not exclusively to his Egyptian community. He has been practicing his shoe-making activity for nearly thirty years and, in this way, he has been able to raise his children and support his wife, even though he has been the sole financial provider for his family.
“Gezim is the most good-natured and responsible person. You find him at his shop every day.” These were comments from one of his clients.

loans.use: to buy materials for his shoe-repair business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Progress Grp Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Merenziana from Masvingo. She is married and has four children, three attending school. She also cares for three dependents. For the past 5 years, Merenziana has run an agricultural business selling chickens. She says that her main challenge is that some chicks die at an early age. Merenziana has requested a loan of 400 USD to buy additional chicks and feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Merenziana plans to open a shop in town for selling chickens in bulk.

loans.use: to buy additional chicks

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is aged 34 years and a farmer in Kitale county, Kenya. She lives with her husband and five children; two of the children are still schooling. Joyce has been in farming for over ten years, producing eggs, bananas, sugarcane and milk, which she sells at the nearby market in her area.

She is requesting a 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. The cow will provide her with more milk for sale and earn her extra income, which will help her to improve her living standard and to pay for her children's schooling in the future. Joyce aspires to have bought a pick-up for transporting her produce, in the next five years.

Competition, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming. She is very thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for offering the loan to her.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 30 years old. She is married and has three kids. She has been running a business of selling babies' items, for two years. With the loan, she wants to buy more Pampers, towels and kids' clothes, for sale. She plans to use the profits for savings, to have a better store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more kids' clothes, towels and Pampers, for resale.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 45 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her tailoring business. 

The loan will help her to expand her tailoring business, which she has been running very efficiently since 1998. She wants the financing to invest in purchasing a new sewing machine.  She believes in hard work and honesty. She is confident that the loan will bring positive changes to her business and will increase her profit.

Yasmeen has two buffaloes as well. She sells their milk in the market. With the profit, she wants to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk selling business also. This will help her to increase her net income and savings. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 41 years old and married with four children, who are all school-going.  He also has two dependents who are orphans living with him.

William started a small hardware shop in 1997 as his major source of income to look after the family.  He operates this business in the outskirts of Kagadi Town, and his major clients are residents of his village.

William wants a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (three million shillings) to buy more stock of cement and other hardware materials to meet the demand for  construction materials.  He anticipates getting more profits if he is funded.  He will also  be in a better position to educate his children as well as to put up a permanent house for the family.  However, his major challenge is the weather, most especially if it rains, making transportation difficult. There is also a lot of competition in the market.

William would like the lender to offer different loan products to help alleviate of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for his hardware shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yerlin Yuritza

texts.es:
Yerling , habitante de la ciudad de Estelí , 36 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos de 20, 8 y 2 años respectivamente , de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender fritanga(comidas típicas fritas). Inicio con muy poco capital pero con una gran necesidad de salir adelante por el  bienestar de sus hijos, como todos los días inicia sus labores como ama de casa y dueña de  negocio sale a hacer la comprar de la materia prima como platanos, aceite ,arroz, empaque para sus comidas posterior alista su humilde cocina de leña prepara los alimentos alrededor de las 5 de la tarde pone su mesita de plástico, mantel, recipiente de ensalada y la comida lista apara solo esperar la llegada de su clientela y cierra hasta que se le acabe el ultimo plato de su sabroso Gallo pinto(arroz con frijoles fritos y salsita) Nica . Esta labor la realiza a diario con la firme esperanza de conseguir ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Uno de sus planes es tener  una comideria con mejores condiciones de infraestructura, tener sillas , mesas, vitrinas poder contratar ayudantes , vender a domicilio.
Está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar arroz, frijoles, plátanos, aceite, condimentos, leña, carbón, empaques para comida.
texts.en:
Yerlin lives in the city of Estelí. She is 36 years of age, and a single mother to three children aged 20, 8, and 2. A trader by profession, she works selling fried homemade food.

She began with very little capital but a great need to be successful for the wellbeing of her children. Every day she starts her work as a housewife and business owner going out to buy raw material such as plantains, oil, rice, and food packaging. Later she prepares her humble wood stove and prepares the food. At around 5 in the afternoon she sets up her plastic table, table cloth, salad container and the food, ready. She only awaits the arrival of her customers. It closes when she runs out of the last plate of her tasty Nicaraguan Gallo pinto (fried rice and beans). 

She does this work daily with the firm hope of earning an income to help her children to get ahead. One of her plans is to have a cafeteria with better infrastructure conditions, to have chairs, tables, and chiller cabinets and to be able to employ helpers, and to sell door-to-door.

She is applying for the funding to buy rice, beans, plantains, oil, condiments, firewood, coal, and packaging for food.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, plantains, oil, condiments, firewood, coal, and packaging for food.

loans.name: Tapdiq

texts.en:
Tapdiq is a 55-year-old man, who is married and has two children. He is a market trader and sells jewelry. The products he sells are very popular, especially among women, who usually come to buy new jewelry of gold. Tapdiq`s products are all made of gold, because this is a very popular metal and Azerbaijani people value gold very much. His monthly income is 300 AZN. He rents a small shop in the local mall, and he has about 15 years of experience in this field. 

Tapdiq would like to diversify the products he has available for sale and purchase Turkish gold jewelry items, which are in high demand. He applied for 1500 AZN to reach this goal.

loans.use: to diversify and purchase Turkish gold jewelry

loans.name: Dominga Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Dominga Pascuala esta casad, tiene 34 años de edad, cursó los 2 grados de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes y servilleta, trabajo que inicio por iniciativa propia, lleva hasta el momento 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos y labores, quiere que su negocio pueda seguir prosperando y poder tener otros telares y trabajadores, de esa forma podrá mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dominga Pascuala is married, is 34 years old, she completed 2 grades of elementary school, and she has three kids who are studying. She works in the knitting of cortes and napkins, work that she started on her initiative. She has up to now 8 years of experience and she counts on the support of her husband who works in trade. 

She is requesting a loan to use it in the purchase of threads and supplies. She wants her business to continue to prosper and to have more looms and workers, in this way she will be able to improve the condition of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase yarn

loans.name: Jilma Guillermina

texts.es:
Jilma Guillermina de  51 años de edad, casada con dos hijos, mayores de edad, los cuales estudian en la universidad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Jilma se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, el cual ha demostrado en sus créditos anteriores en los pagos en tiempo y forma. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar en su juventud por falta de recursos económicos, y ha tenido que trabajar desde muy joven.
Gracias a su capacidad e emprendimiento y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación,. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampo, caja de fosforo, leche, pan, cuajada, queso, crema, jugos, gaseosas. La rutina diaria de Jilma es trabajar unas 12 horas diaria ofreciendo sus productos .El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería. Jilma Guillermina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jilma Guillermina, 51, is married and has two adult children that go to the university. She is originally from León, which is located in the western region of the country. Jilma is a hardworking and responsible woman, something she has proved by paying the previous loans in time. Unfortunately, she could not study when she was young due to the lack of resources and she had to work instead.

Thanks to her abilities, her entrepreneurial mindset and will to progress, she opened a “pulpería” in her house. A “pulpería” is a small store where one can find supplies in small quantities, such as coffee bags, shampoo sachets, match boxes, milk, bread, cottage cheese and other types of cheese, cream, juices and beverages. Jilma works twelve hours per day.

With the loan, Jilma plans to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling supplies. Jilma Guillermina appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give people with few resources from poor countries like Nicaragua, which allows them to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy supplies such as coffee bags, shampoo sachets, milk, bread, cheese and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en:
Shalala is a 23-year-old, married woman, who is raising one son. She breeds cows and cattle, and she sells dairy products, and sells cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Shalala has five years of experience in this field, thanks to her father, who taught her the best ways to look after cattle.

Shalala usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt she sells to the neighbors. She earns 80 AZN income per month, from selling dairy products and meat.

Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

Shalala applied for 1000 AZN to purchase one milking cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is a young entrepreneur, 24 years of age. He is single and lives with his parents. He has been selling mobile phones and accessorizes for the past four years. With the help of his father, he was able to start his business. He usually works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m., because many people are coming after work to look for new mobile phones. In summer, his working hours are getting longer. He is a very hard-working and polite man, that’s why his sales are high -- 190 AZN per month.

He applied for 1,500 AZN to purchase some of the most-demanded phones, like Samsung and iPhones, which he expects will increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy some of the most-demanded phones, like Samsung and iPhones, which he expects will increase his sales.

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en:
Vusala is 34 years old and a widow, raising alone three daughters. She is a market vendor. After several years of attempts to find a job, she decided to start her business. She has four years of experience in the trading field. 

She sells office supplies, which are very popular for offices and schools, as well as food products, in her shop. Her monthly income is 350 AZN. She applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise for her shop's inventory, which will increase her sales. The products she sells are in very high demand, and Vusala wishes to meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy more office supplies and food products, for her shop's inventory

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en:
Zumrud is a 47-year-old woman, who is married with two children. She is a market vendor, and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. She has five years of experience, and has a deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients. Her pension is not enough to cover basic needs, and she decided to start her own business. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 200 AZN.  Her husband helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase more food products and to diversify her range of goods to cover customers` demand. This will be her second loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products and diversify her range of goods.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: Hola, desde Perú,  les presento  a un grupo conformado por 8 integrantes  con gran iniciativa para los negocios, así se caracteriza el grupo comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Micaela Bastida”. Una de  los integrantes  es la Sra. Reyna de 49 años de edad, casada y madre de 1 hijo, el cual es  su  empuje de superación diaria, la Sra. Reyna desde muy temprano  se dedica a la venta  de prendas de vestir  que vende en un pequeño puesto que instalo en su domicilio. Para  así poder salir  adelante y prosperar como pequeña comerciante. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de prendas de vestir  tales como blusas y camisetas,  para su posterior venta. La Sra. Reyna está muy contenta  por el préstamo otorgado y agrádese  el interés brindado y la confianza que han depositado en ella, deja la promesa de seguir superándose, para mejorar la calidad de vida  de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Hello, from Peru. I introduce you to a group with 8 participants with a great initiative for business.  This is the characteristic of the group “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Micaela Bastida” (Entrepreneurial Women of Micaela Bastida).  One of the group members is Reyna who is 49-years-old, married, and a mother of 1 boy who is her motivation for self-improvement everyday. 

Reyna works since early in the morning selling articles of clothing that she sells in a small booth that she installed in her home.  She did this to get ahead and prosper as a small business owner. 

With the loan she will invest the money in the purchase of clothing articles such as t-shirts and blouses for retail.  Reyna is very happy with the loan given and is grateful for the interest shown and the confidence that has been entrusted to her. She promises to continue improving herself for the better quality of life for herself and her family

loans.use: to purchase blouses and t-shirts

loans.name: Bulondo Bii Group

texts.en:
Bulondo Bii Group is located in Bungoma South District. It is a group of nine women and one man, led by Joyce, who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Joyce is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to work as a group, so that she could grow enough food for her family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Joyce was only able to harvest two bags of maize per half-acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains of 2012, she was able to harvest seven bags per half-acre. She plans to use the profits from future harvests, to send her children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs, on credit. Bulondo Bii Group will receive a total of five acres' worth of inputs, on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Udaya Bhanu

texts.en:
Udaya Bhanu is a 37-year-old physically challenged person living with his wife and two children. His wife is a homemaker and his two children are still schooling. He is engaged in the activity of running a small poultry farm, from which he earns 6,000 INR per month.

Udaya Bhanu has a plan and idea to enlarge his business by adding some more chicks to his poultry farm and to renovate his farmhouse. He wants to install an automated water and food feeding machine for the chicks.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 INR for purchasing chicks, their food and medicines, and for his farm renovation. 

Udaya Bhanu has a dream to make his children well-educated, give his family a good and quality life, and save some money for his children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, their food and medicines for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Eli lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a battery service shop, a business in which he charges batteries. The business has been in operation for three years.
 
He learned about Milango through friends, who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are inflation and bad debts. 

Eli is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings, to buy battery acid and a charging machine. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, used to improve the living standard of his family, and used to repay the loan. He anticipates great business, once the rural electrification program is complete.

loans.use: To buy battery acid and a charging machine.

loans.name: Kamala Kanta

texts.en:
Kamala Kanta is a 26-year-old differently abled person living with his parents in a village of Odisha, India. Currently he is engaged in the activity of providing tuition to the village children at his home. He earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity, which is not sufficient for his family. His parents’ health condition is also not good.

He has a plan to start a variety store where he will sell biscuits, wafers, electric bulbs, spices, lentils, hair oil, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc. He says that doing so will increase his family's income, and he would be able to take good care of his parents.

Kamala Kanta has requested a loan of 30,000 INR for purchasing the above items and building a variety shop.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, wafers, electric bulbs, spices, lentils, hair oil, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc. for his variety store.

loans.name: Lemashon

texts.en:
Lemashon is 27 years old. He is still single and supports his parents. He has been running a retail shop for the past four years, making a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 50,000. He plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of cooking fat, washing detergents, and maize flour, for resale in his shop. 

The anticipated profits will be reinvested into his business. His future dream is to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, washing detergents, and maize flour, for resale in his shop

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio  vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Él se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, canastas de mimbre, artículos de barro, adornos entre otros, tiene mucho tiempo con el negocio y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite realizar un trabajo excelente y al mismo tiempo tiene la oportunidad de obtener muy buenas ganancias con las ventas, sabe que es un negocio muy rentable y ya tiene mucha clientela, pues su trabajo es de primera calidad los precios muy accesibles y además con un servicio excelente, sus clientes siempre quedan satisfechos; José es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador, con muchos propósitos a futuro, piensa que para  tener éxito, debes saber qué estás haciendo y te debe gustar lo que haces pues eso te ayuda a poner mas empeño y compromiso, el cree en su sueño de hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mimbre, madera, barniz, barro, herramienta etc. José Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Antonio lives with his life companion and children in his own house. He makes handicrafts, wicker baskets, clay objects and decorations among other items. He has had his business for a long time and has gained valuable experience that enables him to produce excellent work and at the same time make a very good living from his sales. He knows that his is a very profitable business and he has many customers since his work is of the highest quality and his prices are very accessible. In addition, he offers excellent service and his clients are always very satisfied.

José is an honest and very hardworking man, who has many goals for the future. He thinks that to be successful, you must know what you are doing and you have to like what you do since this helps you to be more committed and to put forth more effort. He believes in his dream of making his business grow. Consequently he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to purchase rattan, wood, varnish, clay, tools, etc. 

José Antonio has a very good credit history and moral character. He assures that he will be able to pay off the debt and he is confident that he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rattan, wood, varnish, clay and tools.

loans.name: Yessenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yessenia Elizabeth vive junto a su hija y sus padres en casa propia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos, queso duro, queso fresco,  cuajada entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le  permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar y es muy conocida en la localidad la gente la recomienda porque sus quesos son los de mejor sabor, hechos con material de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, Yessenia es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy motivada a salir adelante, le gusta luchar por sus sueños sabe que si se esfuerza al máximo lograra lo que se propone y tendrá mucho éxito en su vida. Comprometida con sus metas, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar leche por mayor, sal, coladores, etc.  Yessenia Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Yessenia Elizabeth lives with her daughter and parents in their own home. She works in the production and sale of cheeses, including hard and soft cheeses, curdled cheese among others. She has many years in the business and this has given her a lot of experience in sales.  This allows her to always get the best profits. She is an ambulatory retailer and also sells from her home. She is very well known in her locality and people recommend her because her cheeses have the best flavor, are made with the best ingredients, sold at affordable prices, provides unsurpassed service at the order of her clients.

Yessenia is dedicated to her work, energetic, and motivated to get ahead. She likes to pursue her dreams and she knows that with enough effort she will accomplish her goals and will have much success in her life. 

Committed to her goals as any good businessperson, she wants to increase the business and realize a new investment.  Therefore she is requesting a credit that will allow her to buy wholesale milk, salt, strainers, etc. Yessenia Elizabeth has very good credit references and a unstained moral quality. She is certain that she will repay the debt and at the same time that she will be able to bring to her home financial security.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale milk, salt, and strainers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has four children, and only two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business, selling used clothes, and she has been in this clothing business for five years. Besides running the clothing business, Margaret generates additional income by braiding ladies' hair.

She works at the market six day a week and sells clothes at retail, only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 57 years old, married, and has raised three sons, two of whom are now grown and work as salespersons, helping the family's budget. Asif receives a disability pension.

For more than 17 years Asif has been in the farming business to earn extra money, better support his family and educate his children. He sells milk and trefoil that he collects from the fields. In the future, he plans to expand the number of animals he has to increase his profit from the sale of milk products.

Asif wants to make repairs to his home, as for many years the family has experienced poor living conditions. He has requested a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is aged 50. She is a farmer in Kisii county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and four children. Only one child is still schooling. She has been in farming for over 20 years producing milk, maize, beans and bananas, which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 62,400 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that will provide her with more milk for sale and earn her extra income, which she will use to uplift her living standards and pay for her child’s schooling. She aspires to have bought another dairy cow  and be able to supply milk in large quantities in the next five years.

Diseases and fluctuation of prices are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Njoroge

texts.en:
Njoroge, a 77-year-old widower with one dependent son, owns rental houses. He has been in this business for 22 years now and gets a monthly income of 40,000 shillings.

This will be Njoroge's ninth loan with KADET LTD, which he plans to use to repair and paint his rental houses. He hopes to grow his business and be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to repair and paint his rental houses.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 29-year- old married woman. She has been sewing gloves for many years. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

Therefore she applied for a loan of PKR 35000 from Kashf Foundation. She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle and intends to use this loan amount to buy material such as spools of threads with the packs of needles to increase revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income. She desires to provide a good standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy material such as spools of threads with the packs of needles.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms. Shazia is a 27-year-old married woman, and a mother of one child.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to fulfill the needs of her family members. To help her to continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 33 years old. He is married to Loise, and they are blessed with two children. He is a taxi operator at Kangemi and has been in the business for six years. He earns a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.

This will be Josphat's first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to take his car for servicing. 

He will plow the profits back into his business, and in the future he hopes to own a tour company and provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 55 years old, and a married woman with six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past 10 years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and she is known for providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family.

It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation. She has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She wishes to spend her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Ms. Musarat is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been making samosas, which is a fried or baked pastry with a savory filling (such as spiced potatoes, onions, and ground chicken), for the past three years. She sells it to the people of her community and in the local market. Her husband is employed at a small general store and does not earn enough income to provide his family with bread and butter. This compelled her to initiate her own business to support her family.

Musarat has five children. She is motivated to provide them with a beautiful life including good education, food, and clothing. In order to meet customers’ demands time after time, she needs to purchase packs of oil, salt, and spices. For this she applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to get an increase in her sales and desires to use the earned profits for her children’s educations.

loans.use: to purchase packs of oil, salt, and spices

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Nabila is 20 years old. She has been in carpet manufacturing for many years to contribute in the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Rozleen

texts.en:
Ms. Rozleen is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been in the work of making Nimko (a traditional spicy and yummy snack) for two years. She earns enough to contribute to the family income. She also does the part of packaging at home and then sells to the people of her community and in a local market.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requests a loan of 20,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees) to buy stock of ingredients such as assorted daals (lentils) and dried fruits in large quantities to increase her sales. She wishes to spend a part of the profits on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients such as assorted daals (lentils) and dried fruits in large quantities to increase her sales.

loans.name: Adeela

texts.en: Ms. Adeela is a 24-year-old unmarried lady; she has been running a beauty parlour for three years. Instead of becoming a burden on her family, she started her own business at the corner of her house. Through her services, she has become famous on her street and makes enough money to contribute to the family income. To cope with the customers’ demands time after time she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for her parlour. For this she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy hair care products, makeup kits, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, makeup kits, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is forty eight years old. He is married to Franciscah and they are blessed with seven children. He operates a taxi business and has been in business for five years. He earns a monthly salary of seventy five thousand shillings. 

This will be Alfred's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to service his car and pay the school fees for his children. 

He will use the profits to diversify his business. In the future he hopes to own a touring company.

loans.use: to service his taxi and also pay for school fees

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms. Rehana is a 53-year-old married woman. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failed. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for their better future. Twenty years ago she began stitching work at her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She provides for four children. 

She is currently in her first loan cycle and has borrowed Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, and zippers to increase revenues so she may generate a healthier source of income. She wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, and zippers

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 46-year-old widow and a mother of four children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing and health. She started her business of sewing to contribute to the family income. She has gained five years of experience in this field. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of 30,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees) to buy more spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. She will then be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He invested the first loan he received into tea tree farming. Out of the information he has received on the benefits of investing in tea trees, he has decided to apply for another loan in order to reinvest into tea tree farming.
 
He is therefore asking for a loan of 10,734 Kenya shillings (Kenyan shillings) to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Ms. Safia is a 48-year-old vigorous, married woman and a mother of eight children. She has had a business of hand embroidery for the past six years. One of her daughters also assists her in making beautiful patterns. Safia is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. She has become popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. For the improvement of her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet with her clients' increasing demands. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities for her embroidery business

loans.name: Bulondo E Group

texts.en:
Janpher is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Bulondo E Group members. The 10 of them - 9 women and 1 man - are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to Janpher on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Janpher is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 long rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for her family and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Last year, Janpher harvested 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 long rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 long rains season, Janpher’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Ms. Tahira is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. She has good communication skills and holds a good client list. Tahira makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 Rs (Pakistan rupees) to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet with the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms. Zahida is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. She has good communication skills and holds a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Zahida makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide them with good food, health and education. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 Rs (Pakistan rupees) to buy stock of rice, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with the educational expenses of her children and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, grains and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a farmer in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a tea tree farm, a business he has been operating for two years now. Besides this, he is a horticultural farmer, planting potatoes, maize, and beans, as well as cattle rearing. The oil from his plants is used to manufacture cosmetics.

Benson learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are lack of funds and water.

Benson is applying for a loan of 30,653 Kenyan shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family. He aspires to increase the acreage under tea tree farming.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius used his previous loan well and in good time. He is now 25 years old and his business is doing well.

He has a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past two years now. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle so that he can meet the demands of his customers.

Julius hopes to build his own house in the near future and expand his transport business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora's group is comprised of hard working women. Debora is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Debora has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Debora has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food, such as bananas and cassava, for selling. It will help Debora to generate greater profits and develop her business. Debora hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Debora is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food, such as bananas and cassava, for selling

loans.name: Bulondo B Group

texts.en:
Augustine is a member of Bulondo B Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with 14 One Acre Fund farmers: 11 women and 3 men. 

Augustine is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Augustine first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains reason and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and learn new farming skills.

Augustine described his harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Augustine’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7 acres of land.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children. She owns a tea tree farming business, a business which she has been operating this business ten years now. She also has an agricultural farm, dealing in maize, beans, potatoes, etc. in small scale.

She learned about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group and she joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenge she faces is lack of water.

Margaret is applying for a loan of 20,730 Kenyan shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the agricultural business. Her future plan in five years time is to open a cereals shop.

loans.use: buy tea tree seedlings

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single mother of five children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 

Grace has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years, selling to all categories of people on retail. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income by selling green bananas. 

Grace works seven days a week, works from her home, and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 49 years old. She lives in the small village of Gardabani District with her parents and 2 daughters.  Her parents are provided with a retirement pension and her daughters go to school. Liana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products. In addition, they have 50 sheep and sell lambs locally. Liana also works as a pharmacist at local chemistry shop, but her income is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Liana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to the country rural poor, who  do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.
