texts.es: Dominga vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella vende producto por catalogo, cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros, además para complementar los gastos del hogar vende antojitos típicos, el negocio se ubica en el lugar que califico como muy buena para sus actividades comerciales, ya tiene varios años de manejar las ventas y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia,  tiene ya mucha clientela fija pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, higiene, buenos precios pero sobre todo porque es el servicio más rápido; Dominga es una mujer emprendedora siempre dispuesta a superarse, quiere alcanzar el éxito por eso se esfuerza día con día, esta muy comprometida con su futuro, en las últimas semanas ha aumentado la demanda por lo que Dominga quiere aumentar la producción  y venta pero necesita de la compra de insumos y no posee el capital suficiente por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar Cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, etc. Dominga tiene buen record de pago y tiene una moral intachable, asegura que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida como se la merece.
texts.en:
Dominga lives with her life partner and their children in their own home. She sells products through catalogs- creams, perfumes, and cosmetics, among others. Furthermore, to be able to pay home expenses, she sells typical snacks. The business is located in a place that she describes as very good for her commercial activities. Since she has managed sales for many years, she has gained a lot of experience. She already has many steady customers since people prefer her because of the quality of her products, cleanliness, and good prices, but above all because she provides the fastest service. 

Dominga is an entrepreneurial woman always willing to improve. She wants to reach success, and therefore she makes an effort day by day. She is very committed to her future. In the last few weeks, demand has increased, for which Dominga wants to increase production and sales. She needs to purchase the supplies but does not possess sufficient capital. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that allows her to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc. Dominga has a good record of payment and has a high moral character. She pledges that she will be able to pay back the funding and at the same time give to her family the better quality of life that it deserves.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoe soles, accessories, brooches and other decorative items for responding to client orders.

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es: José Enrique vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos en casa propia. Él posee una ladrillera desde hace mucho tiempo y tiene mucha experiencia en la venta lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en una calle principal muy transitada, un lugar muy estratégico para las ventas, es muy conocido en la zona pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con producto de calidad y a precio accesible además el servicio es excelente; José es un hombre dedicado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan concretar su objetivo de llegar al éxito, desde hace algún tiempo la demanda en su negocio ha aumentado al doble y no quiere decepcionarlos por eso ha decidido aumentar la producción e invertir es así como le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar barro, cemento, saltex, herramienta etc. José Enrique tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
José Enrique lives with his parents and siblings in their own home, and he has operated a brick business for some time now. With lots of experience in manufacturing and selling bricks, he is able to get fair sale prices for his products. His business is located on a central, busy street, in an ideal location for attracting new clients and making sales. José is well known in the area for offering high quality work, first class service, and good products at very fair prices.

José is very dedicated to his work, and always puts forth his best effort. He is always looking for new opportunities to expand and grow his business. Recently, customer demand for José's products has doubled, and since he does not want to cut corners and disappoint his customers, he has decided to invest in an increase in overall production. José hopes this loan with INTEGRAL will be the right investment in and for his business, and he plans to use the support from this loan to purchase clay, cement, saltex, tools, and other input items for manufacturing bricks. José is a very responsible person, and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time. He hopes this loan will help him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase clay, cement, saltex and tools for his brick manufacturing business.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor Es un hombre muy conocido por sus vecinos por ser un hombre muy entregado a su familia es trabajador, honesto, servicial su mayor sueño es seguirle brindando lo mejor su familia y que en su hogar nunca falte el pan de cada día. Con esfuerzo ha logrado obtener un ganado y tambien cultiva granos basicos como maiz y frijol y es así como se gana la vida honradamente vendiendo lo que sus Ganado de brinda. Victor desea comprar insumos para que su ganado se mantenga bien, que no se le enferme ni que les pase nada malo es por eso que solicita  INTEGRAL  un préstamo para la compra de:  Vitaminas, Minerales, Forraje, concentrado. Espera recibir el préstamo acordado y así poder comprar lo necesario y seguir siendo el hombre ejemplar para su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is a man who is very well-known by his neighbors for being a man who is very committed to his family.  He is hard-working, honest, and selfless.  His biggest dream is to continue giving his family the best and that his household never lacks for its daily bread.

With effort he has managed to get livestock.  He also grows basic crops like corn and beans.  This is how he honorably earns a living from his livestock.

Victor wishes to buy supplies to keep his livestock well so they do not get sick of have something bad happen to them.  That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  He will use the loan to buy vitamins, minerals, fodder, and concentrated feed.  He hopes to receive the loan in order to buy what is needed and to continue being an exemplary man for his family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, minerals, fodder, and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es: Patricia Guadalupe vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, tiene en variedad camisas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, entre otros,  tiene muchos años de poseer el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas lo cual le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, ella tiene su venta en un lugar muy estratégico muy concurrido de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precio accesible y con un servicio excelente; Patricia es una mujer comprometida con sus sueños, dedicada a su labor, todos los días se levanta con la disposición de luchar por un futuro mas  prospero pues sabe que solo así tendrá éxito; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda  y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Patricia Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias y es muy responsable, se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo y  asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Patricia Guadalupe lives with her life partner and her son in her own home. She buys and sells clothing for men and women. She has a variety of shirts, pants, dresses, blouses, and other styles. She has run this business for many years and she has gained a lot of experience in sales which helps her to earn more. Her sales site is located in a strategic part of the city, where many people come through. She has gained many clients because they prefer her for her higher quality items and affordability as well as her excellent service. Patricia is dedicated to achieving her dreams and dedicated to her work; she gets up every day with the attitude of being ready to fight for a better tomorrow because she knows that this is the only way she will achieve success. In recent weeks, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this situation to make a new investment in her business. This is why she is asking for a loan with INTEGRAL that will help her purchase more wholesale clothing. Patricia Guadalupe has good references and is a responsible person, she is grateful for the support she is receiving and assures us that she will be able to settle her debt while at the same time being able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Evelio Vasquez

texts.es: Evelio de 53 años de edad vive junto a su familia. Es un hombre con grandes aspiraciones y deseos de superación, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un buen trabajador y todo hay sido inspirado por su familia. Siempre el su hogar jamás falta el pan de cada día y esto lo hace un gran hombre, padre ejemplar y buen esposo. Evelio se dedica al cultivo de Hortalizas es decir Tomate , guisquil ayote y pepino en tiempos. Es un hombre que siempre ha trabajado y no descansa con sus cosechas  es por eso que se acerca a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así comprar insumos necesarios como: Pesticidas, Insecticidas, Abonos para que sus cosechas no presenten problemas y él los pueda vender de manera que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día y sobre todo que siga siendo el hombre ejemplar que es en su casa.
texts.en:
Evelio is 53 years old, and lives with his family. He is a man of big dreams and vision, and is known for being a hard-working man who is dedicated to his family. Evelio works very hard to provide for his family, and always strives to be a good husband and father. He makes a living as a tomato, squash and cucumber farmer. 

Evelio works year round and does not take time off after harvests. With the support from this loan, he plans to purchase important input items for tending his crops and land, including: pesticides, insecticides and manure. He hopes that these products will protect and strengthen his crops in the coming growing season, and will allow him to sell his vegetables for a good price so that he can continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase input items for his farming operation, including pesticides, insecticides and manure.

loans.name: Carlos De Jesus

texts.es: Carlos de Jesús, habita en casa de su  propiedad junto con su esposa e hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de los principales granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad toda su vida por lo que tiene ya mucha experiencia. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme amabilidad con las demás personas. Debido a que la temporada para la siembra se aproxima y ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos, ha tomado la decisión de comenzar a prepararse para la llegada de esta y es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Carlos confía en que  su cosecha sea abundante ya que es la única forma que conoce y hace para lograr tener acceso a una fuente de ingresos y darle el sustento y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos de Jesús lives in his own house on his property with his wife and children. He works in agriculture, planting basic crops like corn and beans. He has been involved in this activity his whole life, and so, he has a lot of experience. He is a hard worker, responsible and is well known in his area for his friendliness with others. Because the planting season is approaching, and this is his only income source, he has made the decision to begin to prepare and would like to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchasing of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides etc. Carlos tells us that his harvests are abundant and that this is the way he knows how to access an income source and to sustain his family while offering them a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides etc.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de Jesus vive junto con su Familia.  Él se dedica  a la agricultura de los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol, después de sacar la cosecha  comercializa una parte de su cultivo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar que cada día son mayores. Él es  trabajador, emprendedor cuya principal motivación es darle el sustento y una buena calidad de vida a su familia con el fruto de su trabajo. Ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y es así como ha logrado formar su hogar, ya que esta es su principal fuente de ingresos tomo la decisión de acercarse a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito ya que la fecha para empezar las siembras se aproximan y quiere asegurar el terreno para su próxima siembra. Este préstamo le servirá  para invertir en la comprar de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos, etc. para comenzar la siembra lo más antes posible. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel de Jesus lives with his family.  He works in agriculture growing basic grains such as corn and beans.  After harvesting his crops he sells some of them to provide for his family's needs, which increase every day.  He is a hardworking entrepreneur whose main motivation is to support his family and provide them with a good quality of life with the fruits of his labor.  He has worked in agriculture all of his life and that is how he has been able to set up his home, as this is his primary source of income.  He decided to approach INTEGRAL to request a loan because the time to begin planting is coming and he wants to ensure the land is ready for the next crop.  This loan will be used to purchase agricultural products such as seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, etc.  to begin planning as soon as possible. He is confident that he will obtain an abundant crop which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products such as seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Berta Cruz

texts.es: Berta Cruz vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de alboroto, quesadillas y ricos tamales, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado preciada experiencia que le permite obtener el máximo de ganancias, es muy conocida en la zona pues elabora su producto con un sabor inigualable, comercia desde su hogar y de forma ambulante ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad a precios accesibles y con un servicio excelente; Berta  es una mujer dedicada a su labor, siempre dispuesta a aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa grandes logros pero también se esfuerza por cumplirlos, quiere acrecentar el negocio, invertir en insumos para aumentar la producción pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maicillo, maíz, carne, verduras, etc. Berta Cruz tiene muy buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, esta muy contenta con el apoyo y agradece de antemano, confía en que saldara el financiamiento y a la vez llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Berta Cruz lives with her life partner in a home they own.  She sells popcorn, quesadillas, and delicious tamales.  She has had a small business for many years which has provided her with valuable experience so she can make the highest earnings.  She is well known in the area because her product tastes like no other.  She sells from her home and in the streets.  She has many customers because people know her products are quality at reasonable prices, and with excellent service.  Berta is a woman who is dedicated to her work.  She is always open to taking advantage of opportunities that present themselves.  She dreams of great successes but also works hard to achieve them.  She wants to grow her business and invest in ingredients to increase her production, but she needs help in the form of capital.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase sorghum, corn, meat, vegetables, etc.  Berta Cruz has very good credit references and is responsible.  She is very happy with the support and thankful in advance.  She is confident that she will pay off the loan and at the same time bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum, corn, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es: José Eliseo se dedica  al cultivo y comercio de maíz. Vive en su casa propia junto a su familia. Cada año repite esta actividad y se esfuerza para que sea mejor que el año anterior, es así como se gana la vida y es importante mencionar que es su principal fuente de ingresos. José se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y muy responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él y confían en el producto que comercializa. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a INTEGRAL, para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar los principales insumos agrícolas semillas, insecticidas, abonos, etc. Y continuar cultivando la tierra para cosechar los principales  granos básicos que le permiten llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Confía en que este año será mejor y podrá así darle a su familia un mejor futuro
texts.en:
José Eliseo works as a corn farmer, and lives with his family in their own home. He works hard to make each growing season and harvest better than the previous one, and his farming operation is his primary source of income. José is well known in his community for being a hard-working, honorable and responsible man, and everyone knows that he farms and sells high quality corn.

With the support from this loan, José plans to purchase agricultural input items for his farming operation, including seeds, insecticides and manure, etc. He hopes that this investment will help him to strengthen and increase his upcoming harvest, providing a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase input items for his farming operation, including: seeds, insecticides, manure, etc.

loans.name: Jose Baudilio

texts.es: José Baudilio vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, los años de trabajo en el rubro le han regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola muy fértil y cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, lo buenos precios y el excelente servicio; José es un hombre amable, honesto muy dedicado a su labor todos los días lucha por ganarse un futuro mejor sabe que con todo su esfuerzo y dedicación lograra el éxito que desea y esta totalmente comprometido con sus sueños; en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. José Baudilio tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José lives together with his wife and their children in their own home. He works in agriculture, specifically in corn farming. Years of working in this activity has given him valuable experience, which allows him to have better harvests. His farmland is located in an area of high agricultural prevalence; it is very fertile and close to his home. He sells in all of the surrounding areas and it has given him many customers who prefer him for his quality, good prices, and excellent service. 

José is a kind and honest man who is very dedicated to his labor. Every day, he strives to attain a better future. He knows that with all of his effort and dedication, he will achieve what he desires and is completely committed to his dreams. In the previous growing season, he had some losses and he wants to recover. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy corn seed, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc. José has good payment references. He ensures that he will be able to repay his debt, and at the same time, he has confidence that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, insecticide, herbicide, and tools.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is 22 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling food in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies, such as chips, cookies, snacks, etc. In the future, Elisapeta hopes to save for her children's education and for the betterment of her family. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chips, cookies, snacks, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Iosefina

texts.en: Iosefina is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She would like to start a small business, selling printed material. In order to do this, Iosefina  needs a loan to buy more supplies, such as material, paints, brushes, rollers, etc. She hopes to use her profits to save for her family's betterment and for her kid's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy new materials, paints, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Fidel Raymundo

texts.es: Fidel Raymundo vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia; él posee un vivero comercia todo tipo de plantas, flores, arboles, semillas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y ha ganado mucha experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, comercia desde el lugar que califico como muy bueno para sus actividades, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene plantas de calidad, a muy buen precio además de servicio excelente; Fidel se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad, es un hombre emprendedor dedicado a su labor, siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le ayuden a encontrar un futuro mas prospero, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, últimamente han aumentado las ventas y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar plantas, bolsas, tierra. Fidel Raymundo tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, esta feliz con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda ,a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Fidel lives together with his wife in their own home. He has a nursery, and he sells all types of plants, flowers, trees, and seeds, among other things. He has several years with this business, and he has earned a lot valuable experience in sales, which allows him to yield good earnings. He does business from a location that he described as very good for his activities. Presently he has many customers since they prefer him because he always has quality plants at a very good price, and he also offers excellent service. 

Fidel is known for his great kindness and honesty. He is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his labor. He is always looking for better alternatives that may help him to find a more prosperous future. Every day, he makes a maximum effort since he knows that it is the only way that he will achieve what he desires. Recently, he has increased his sales, and he wants to take advantage of this with a new investment. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy plants, bags, and soil. Fidel has good payment references and is very responsible. He is happy for the support and he ensures that he will be able to payoff his debts, and at the same time, he trusts that he will provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy plants, bags, and soil.

loans.name: Tusigaigoa

texts.en: Tusigaigoa is 34 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling BBQ in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies, such as chicken, sausages, etc. In the future, Tusigaigoa hopes to extend her business and pay for her family commitments. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chicken legs, sausages, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pan cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies, such as flour, sugar, etc. In the future, Susana hopes to save for children's education. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Fretzel

texts.en:
Fretzel is 32 years old and married with four children.

Fretzel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, such as soap, creamer, sugar, spices, etc.

Fretzel has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Fretzel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as soap, creamer, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lernik

texts.ru:
Лерник  родился в 1961году в  селе Сюник,  что в  Сюникской области. После средней школы он поступил и окончил Капанский Строительный Техникум.
В данный момент работает строителем в Капанской строительной компании. Лерник
женат и имеет сына и дочь.
Кроме работы на строительстве Лерник занят скотоводством и сельскохозяйством в родном селе, где имеет участок земли. В этом деле он  почти 20 лет. Лерник на своей ферме имеет крупный рогатый скот,свиней, кур и овец. 
Конечно трудно после тяжелой работы на строительстве заниматся  фермой, и по этому Лернику по сельскому  хозяйству помогают его жена и дети. Круглый год Лерник со своей женой реализует на рынках Капана овощи и фрукты, молоко,мясо и сыр. Прибыль от сельского хозяйства позволяет ему достойно содержать семью. Лерник решил разширить свою ферму и для этого ему нужен кредит на сумму 700,000 Армянских драм  для приобретения двух бычков и для покупки сена для скота.
texts.en:
Lernik was born in 1961 in the village of Syunik in the Syunik Region. After completing secondary school, he enrolled into the Kapan Technical College for Building Construction Technology. At present he works as a construction worker for a construction company in Kapan. Lernik is married and has one son and one daughter.

In addition to working in construction, Lernik raises animals and grows produce in his native village, where he owns a land plot. He has been in this business for almost 20 years. On his farm, he keeps cattle, pigs, chickens, and sheep.

Of course, after hard work in construction, it is difficult to take care of the farm as well, and so Lernik’s wife and children help him out with farm work. Lernik and his wife sell vegetables, fruits, milk, meat products and cheese at the Kapan markets all year round. The revenues from farming allow him to provide for his family in a dignified way. Lernik decided to expand his farm, for which he needs a loan in the amount of 700,000 AMD to buy two bulls as well as hay for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and hay for the cattle.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John de 42 años de edad, es de origen humilde. Su trabajo es su único medio de vida y sostenimiento para su hogar. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad, por los cuales se esfuerza día a día para ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida. Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la reparación y el mantenimiento de equipos de refrigeración, actividad que aprendió gracias a un amigo que labora en el mismo sector. John presta sus servicios a domicilio en el municipio de Santa Bárbara, Colombia y sus veredas. Su Mayor dificultad es el desplazamiento hacia sus clientes, debido a que no cuenta con un medio de transporte. 
Aunque sus necesidades son muchas, este hombre sabe que con paciencia se irán resolviendo. Hoy necesita comprar repuestos y herramientas de trabajo para continuar con su actividad y mejorar su situación económica, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios para dicha inversión.
texts.en:
John is 42 years old and comes from humble circumstances.  His work is his only way of earning a living and sustaining his home.  He has two dependent children and strives every day on their behalf to offer them a better quality of life.

For 6 years, he has worked repairing and maintaining refrigeration units.  He learned this skill thanks to a friend who works in the same field.  Juan travels to his customers' homes in the city of Santa Bárbara, Colombia and its outskirts to work.  His greatest difficulty is getting to his customers, since he doesn't have a means of transit.

Even though his needs are many, he knows that with patience they will get worked out.  Today he needs to buy parts and work tools in order to continue with his work and improve his financial situation.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan, since he doesn't have the means to make this investment on his own.

loans.use: buy parts and work tools.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell, like soap, canned goods, milk, and sugar for her general store business.

Glory has been in this business for eight years. Glory earns more income from fish-vending. Glory has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store, like soap, canned goods, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Las Esmeraldas” que conforman 10 mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 09. Amelia tiene 72 años, con 04 hijos, es la que preside el grupo. Amelia se dedica desde hace 4 años al tejido, teje a pedido chompas, chalecos. Amelia solicito el préstamo para la compra de lanas, hilos, agujas. El sueño de Amelia es de crecer más su negocio. Amelia agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por permitirle seguir creciendo su negocio. Amelia se encuentra en la parte de adelante es la tercera del lado derecho, viste polo blanco y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the "Las Esmeraldas" (The Emeralds) Group, made up of ten enterprising women who work in different business activities. They are on their 9th loan cycle. 

Amelia, 72, has four children, and is the leader of the group. She has worked knitting for four years. She knits sweaters and jackets to order. Amelia is asking for the loan to buy wool, thread, and needles. Her dream is to expand her business. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders, who allow her to continue expanding her business. Amelia is in the front row, third from the right. She is wearing a white shirt and black pants.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a widow and she works hard to support her family. For the past 6 years, she has operated a direct sales personal collection business in the Philippines. Imelda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock, such as soap, dishwashing liquid, toothpaste and shampoo, to sell. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as soap, dishwashing liquid, toothpaste, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer, 35 years old, is married and has four children, all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Jennifer has operated a fishing / fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials for her business. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 8 years, she has operated a furniture making business in the Philippines. Lilia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials such as wood, paint, etc. for her business. In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Ranquilita

texts.en: Ranquilita, 49 years old, is married and has four children, three of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 25 years, Ranquilita has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy motorcycle parts to repair her motorcycle. In the future, Ranquilita would like to save enough money to afford having her children complete college.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Sarlene

texts.en: Sarlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a travel tours agency business in the Philippines. Sarlene requested a 23,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for van maintenance and payment of employee salaries. Sarlene has been in her business for five years now. In the future, Sarlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for van maintenance and payment of employee salaries for her travel tours agency

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Sitha, 41 years old, is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Sitha's husband is a goldsmith who earns $10 daily. In order to improve her husband’s business, Sitha has requested a loan of $1,000 to purchase gold to make fashionable jewelry to sell and thereby earn more profit for the family. In the future, Sitha would like to expand the business and help her children earn their bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase gold to make fashionable jewelry to sell

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana Gladis vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, leche, pan, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su vivienda en una comunidad muy transitada de personas , ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque es la tienda mas surtida con productos de calidad, a muy buenos precios y además con un servicio excelente; Ana es una mujer emprendedora, activa, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Ana Gladis  tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Gladis lives together with her children in her own house. She has a store where she sells basic necessities: staple foods, milk, bread, and soap, among other things. She has run this business for several hears, and she has gained a lot of experience in sales, allowing her to obtain better earnings. The store is located in her home, in a community where many people pass by. She has a lot of customers, because people prefer to come to her store since it is the best-stocked store with quality products at very good prices, and additionally offering excellent service. Ana is an enterprising and active woman, dedicated to her work and with a great desire to get ahead. She is always on the lookout for new opportunities which will open up a path to success. Like every good merchant, she wants to expand her business, but she needs to make a new investment. Thus, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy staple foods, snacks, instant products, beverages, soaps, etc. Ana Gladis has good credit references and is very responsible. She feels very grateful for the help, and she promises that she will be able to cover the debt, and at the same time she has faith that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, snacks, instant products, beverages, soaps, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” que conforman 06 mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 22. Luzmila tiene 43 años, casada con 04 hijos. Desde hace 5 años Luzmila cuenta con una bodega de primera necesidad. Luzmila solicito el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite. El sueño de Luzmila es de crecer más su negocio. Luzmila agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por permitirle seguir creciendo su negocio. Luzmila se encuentra en la parte de adelante es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo rosado y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the group "Mujeres Emprendedoras" [Enterprising Women] that consists of 6 enterprising women that work in various areas of retail.  This is their 22nd loan.  Luzmila is 43 years old and is married with 4 children.  Luzmila has had a basic essentials grocery store for five years and is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil.

Luzmila's dream is to grow her business.  Luzmila thanks Kiva investors for allowing her to continue growing her business.

Luzmila is in the forward part of the photo, first on the right in the pink shirt and black pants.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena vive junto a su pequeña familia en casa propia; ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, posee en variedad camisas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; María es una mujer entusiasta y comprometida con sus metas, se dedica un cien porciento a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. María Elena tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, esta muy contenta y agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica al mismo tiempo que una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Elena lives with her small family in her own home. She works selling clothing for women, men, and children, and has a variety of shirts, dresses, pants, and other items. She has had this business for a number of years, and this has given her lots of sales experience, allowing her to obtain better income. She sells her goods by traveling to different neighborhoods, and also from home. She has built up a good customer base, and people choose her as she always has what they need at affordable prices, and sells quality products with excellent customer service. 

María is an enthusiastic woman, who is committed to meeting her goals. She gives her all to her work, and always strives to achieve what she wants. She will never give up until she achieves the success she deserves. Over the past months demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment. As she has no capital to support this plan, she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy wholesale clothes. María Elena has good payment references and high moral standards, and is very happy with and thankful for this help. She says that she will be able to repay this debt, and also trusts that the loan will provide her with financial security at home, while also offering her a good quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wholesale clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work tools (electric welder, pliers, voltage tester).

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “San Judas Tadeo” que conforman 09 mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 13. Carmen tiene 41 años, con 02 hijos. Desde hace 3 años Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Carmen solicito el préstamo para la compra de perfumes, talcos, cremas. El sueño de Carmen es de terminar de construir su casa. Carmen agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por permitirle seguir creciendo su negocio. Carmen se encuentra en la parte de adelante es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste polo blanco con rayas y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the San Judas Tadeo group, which is made up of nine enterprising female members who work in a number of different businesses. They are on their 13th loan cycle. Carmen is 41 years of age, and has two children. For the past three years she has worked selling beauty products, and has requested a loan to buy perfumes, talcum powders, and creams. 

Carmen’s dream is to finish building her house. She thanks the Kiva investors for allowing her to continue growing her business. Carmen is pictured in the forefront of the picture, the second from the left, wearing a white top with stripes and black pants.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, talcum powder, and creams.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 43 years old, married and has four children.

Josefina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, rice, shampoo and other groceries.

Josefina has borrowed and repaid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns income from fish vending.

Josefina aspires to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, rice, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Madres Coraje Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Madres Coraje” que conforman 12 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 03. Lidia tiene 53 años, casada con 02 hijos. Lidia se dedica desde hace 20 años al tejido, teje a pedido chompas, chalecos. Lidia solicito el préstamo para la compra de lanas, hilos, agujas. El sueño de lidia es de crecer más su negocio. Lidia agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por permitirle seguir creciendo su negocio. Lidia se encuentra en la parte de adelante es la segunda del lado derecho, viste polo amarillo y pantalón morado.
texts.en: This communal bank, “Madres Coraje” (Mother Courage), is made up of twelve members who make their livings in various businesses.  They are in their third cycle.  Lidia is 53-years old, married and has two children.  She has made her living for the past 20 years in textiles.  She takes orders to make jackets and vests.  Lidia is requesting the loan to purchase wool, thread and needles.  Her dream is to grow her business more.  Lidia thanks the Kiva lenders for allowing her to continue growing her business.  In the above photo, Lidia is in the front row, second from the right.  She is wearing a yellow shirt and purple pants.

loans.use: to purchase wool, thread and needles.

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
The members of Wiguna Merta received their loan and the members each received an equal amount.

Ni Ketut used this loan to buy 3 superior piglets. She decided to choose the superior quality piglets because they get a high price when she sells them later. Superior pigs also make it easier to find a buyer. She hope the business can run smoothly and give her enough profit to support her life.

loans.use: to buy 3 superior piglets.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en:
Jade is 45 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jade is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jade has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old, is married and has one kid.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as shampoo, canned goods, frozen foods and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as shampoo, canned goods, frozen foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Lusvisminda

texts.en:
Lusvisminda is 47 years old, is married and has a kid who is in school. Lusvisminda works very hard to provide for them.

Lusvisminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lusvisminda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, bread, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Lusvisminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mery Vic

texts.en: Mery Vic is 37 years old and has two children; one is in school. She has a common-law husband. Mery Vic is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Mery Vic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Najib

texts.en:
Najib is a 51-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children, two of whom are working and the other still attending school. 

In the year 2000, in order to supplement the family’s income, Najib decided to start his own work as a farmer. His job consists of cultivating olive trees in addition to different kind of fruits. In parallel, he started to work in a local company fourteen months ago. 

Today, Najib is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase the required agricultural tools and supplies. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his business productivity by a large percentage, which will return higher profits to him. 

In the future, Najib plans to open a shop where he can sell his harvested goods.

loans.use: to purchase the required agricultural tools and supplies.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a friendly and kind woman. She is from Lebanon and 50 years old. She’s a widowed woman living on her own. 

Since Souad noticed that her income does not satisfy her needs, she decided to launch her clothing business and opened a shop with the small amount of money she already had. She sells a wide variety of women’s and children’s clothes, from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. 

To better develop her work, Souad is requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income. 

Souad wishes to live a peaceful life, and this is what she is trying to do by keeping her work at a good level.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts and many other items.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a responsible mother who runs a small variety store to help her husband in generating income. She aims to improve and strengthen the business to increase her income. She will use the additional income to finance the education of her two children and satisfy their basic necessities. 

She plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers’ needs, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP 20,000 to buy additional stocks of snack foods, beverages, seasonings, soaps, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks to sell. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she believes that she is going to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snack foods, beverages, seasonings, soaps, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sheryll

texts.en:
Sheryll didn't finish college due to an early marriage. She is now 25 years of age and is happily married with one child. 

Sheryll has owned and run her hog raising business for one year. Aside from raising hogs, she is also engaged in selling frozen foods such as sausage, tocino and embutido. The profit Sheryll gains goes to her family's basic necessities, allowance for her only child and the monthly payment for their house rental. 

This time she aims to increase the profit she gains from her hog raising and food production business. For her to achieve her goal, she is seeking additional capital amounting to PHP 27,000. This amount will be used to buy two piglets and hog feed. She knows that through providing her raised hogs with proper nutrition and appropriate hog feed, she will be able to make her hogs healthier, generating greater income. 

Sheryll hopes and prays that her requested loan amount will be granted so she can save for the eduction of her only child and have a viable source of income someday.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and hog feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Alvina

texts.en: Alvina is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in fishing together with her husband for more than 16 years now. This is the source of their income. Alvina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With these supplies, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is married and a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Rosita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business. NWTF is presenting Rosita's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Danilyn

texts.en:
This is Danilyn: 30, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marvin, a pedicab driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Danilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarge her business. 

Danilyn dreams that her children will all finish their studies and hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she won't be bankrupt. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week: there, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and perform maintenance on her and her husband's jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in meeting their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells doormats for additional income. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and perform maintenance on their jeepney unit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes to have more vehicles in the future and dreams of giving her child a good future and a good life.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Alfonso Jr.

texts.en: Alfonso is a 36-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in fishing for five years. He sells fish, shrimp, crab and sea shells to customers in the community. Alfonso requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy a fish net and to renovate his old boat to improve his daily catches. In the future, Alfonso would like to expand his business to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a fish net and to renovate his old boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Deceluna

texts.en: Deceluna is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place and has been in the business for more than four years now. Deceluna is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, beverages and toiletries. In the future, Deceluna has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, beverages and toiletries.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia is a 59-year-old mother who owns and manages a small variety store to generate income. She and her husband aim to upgrade their poor living conditions in order to give their children a bright future. In this regard, Cresencia plans to improve and strengthen her business in order to increase her income. Due to financial difficulty she is asking for an additional PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, medicine, rice and frozen foods to sell. Being a hardworking mother, she believes that she will be able to make an improvement in the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, medicine, rice and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 17 while the youngest is 1 year old. She engages in making home cooked snack foods like doughnuts and shakoy (a mixture of flour, white sugar, salt and yeast that is deep fried, drained and sprinkled with sugar). She has been in the food making business for ten years. Her husband is a driver which earns him only a meager income. Alma requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, yeast and salt to continue to serve her customers. Alma would like expand her business to support her family as well as to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, yeast and salt.

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en:
Elenoa is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling raw-fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more gear such as fishing spears, fishing net, fishing gear, flippers, and etc. 

In the future, Elenoa hopes to save for her children's education and for her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing spears, fishing net, fishing gear, flippers, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She is lucky to be married to a seaman. At present, she acts as a mother and father to their children while her husband is working abroad on a ship. 

Being the head of the family, Ana works hard to meet her children's needs. With her determination to help her husband even in a simple way, she invests her husband remittances in a grocery business to generate income. Ana is selling a variety of commodities like junk food, diapers, and milk for babies. 

Ana wants to extend her business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy shampoo, soap, and spices to sell. She hopes to extend the business, earn higher income, and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, and spices to sell.

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is 23 years old and single with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling cookies in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, etc. In the future, Ioana hopes to save for her children's education and to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, shovels, and a wheel barrow..

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is a hard working woman. She is 41 years old and married with four children. Emelyn manages her vegetable vending and transportation businesses.

Emelyn would like to take out a loan of PHP 4,000 allowing her to improve the growth of her vegetables and ensure the good condition of her motorcycle. She will use this loan to buy new fertilizer and new wheels for her tricycle. She hopes that this loan will be approved, enabling her to provide quality service to her passengers and obtain better profit. In this way, she can educate her youngest child and sustain her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and new wheels for her tricycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Imokene

texts.en: Imokene is a 55-year-old married woman with eight children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. Imokene has requested a loan to buy knives, chemicals, an axe, and a spade for her plantation. Imokene will spend her profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy knives, chemicals, an axe, a spade, etc

loans.name: Sialei

texts.en: Sialei is 32 years old and married with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbages, cucumbers and tomatoes that she can sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sialei needs a loan to buy new equipment for her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Sialei will use the profits from her sales to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe, a spade, etc

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: Angelica is a 35-year-old mother who has four school-age children. Due to financial constraints, she is engaged in buying and selling DVDs & VCDs in her community to supplement her husband's income. She aims to improve the business and make it profitable to generate sufficient income and support her family's needs. To improve the business, she is asking for PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of VCDs and DVDs to sell in her community. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business and make it more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more VCDs and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
This is Maria Victoria. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her child’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. Now she has a variety store and that's where she is focusing her attention.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Victoria dreams that her variety store will be a grocery store. She hopes to have good health for her whole family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Aala

texts.en:
Aala is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has three children. Aala is the only provider of the family.

Aala is a mechanic and owns a small garage. He specializes in fixing the electrical problems of a car. He started working in this field since 1992, and few years later he established his own business. He built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a sum of $2,400 loan to pay the yearly rent of his garage. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his garage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more textiles and tailoring materials for his business

loans.name: Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Neema, who is in her late thirties, is married and has four children who still attend school.  She has been running a retail shop where she sells sugar, salt, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, cooking oil, water, juice, sodas, and biscuits for three years now.  She works from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Neema's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start a poultry business, restock missing items in the shop and cover household expenses.  Neema has fully repaid all her previous loans.  She is going to use this  loan to increase the retail shop's inventory including sugar, wheat flour, baking flour, etc. to resell.  She dreams to one day be able to open a tie and die business.

Neema will share this loan with her loan group, "Ushirika," which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the shop's inventory of foodstocks like sugar, flour and cooking oil to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is asking for a new loan to invest in his business selling cashew nuts and paints. He says that the previous loan helped to start this new business.

Peter is a very responsible man who wants to get ahead in life. He successfully repaid his previous loan and he assures us that he will do the same with this loan. He will buy sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Tupes

texts.en:
Tupes is now 35 years old and a father of two children aged between three and thirteen now. Tupes is a livestock trader whereby he purchases animals to fatten and later resell at a profit.

This will be his second loan after paying back the previous loans successfully. He plans to buy more and quality grade cows to rear and sell later at a profit.

Tupes hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand the livestock farming project from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is do large-scale farming and have his own farm machinery. He is a painstaking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and sheep to fatten and sell later.

loans.name: Derick

texts.en: Derick is an auto mechanic who repairs motorcycles, bicycles and cars. This he has done for 20 years. He is married with three children. He uses his income to provide shelter, food and clothes for his children. Derick will use his loan to acquire more spare parts, tools, and equipment to enable him to service his customers better. With the new profit, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to acquire more spare parts, tools, and equipment

loans.name: Saruni

texts.en:
Saruni is 43 years old and married. He supports a family of four children. He is a wheat and barley farmer and has been in this business for the last six years with a monthly income of KES. 38,000. 

He is servicing his fifth loan of KES. 70,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and purchase of fertilizers and seedlings.

He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to pay for preparation of the  land and purchase  fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. They are all attending school. He is the main income provider of the family and works very hard to be able to handle the heavy life expenses. He has been involved in his occupation since 2009. He is specialized in completing aluminum work. He is well known in his town and has gained a fair number of clients so far. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase an electrical generator for his business in addition to some aluminum supplies. This will definitely allow him to achieve his work competently and become able to present good quality services to the clients.  He works on a freelance basis and hopes to take on bigger projects and increase his earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator for his business in addition to some aluminum supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of goods and products

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a Lebanese single man. He’s 22 years old, living alone with his father, the main income provider of the family. They are really attached to each other and Youssef seeks to take some responsibilities off of his father. Cooperating together, Youssef and his father were capable to cover their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. 

Youssef started his business as a car mechanic. He had to work really hard to prove that he’s a necessary support for his father. He has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy added mechanic's tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract added customers. In the future, he’s planning to enlarge his garage and receive more clients.

loans.use: to buy added mechanic's tools for his business

loans.name: Kifork

texts.en:
Kifork is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and two working children. He is from Lebanon. After his marriage, he became very responsible towards his family and had to work unceasingly so as to support them well financially. In 1992, he opened his own shop where he sells car spare parts. His supplies are used in different types of cars. 

Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase additional spare parts in order to satisfy his customers' demand and provide them with top-quality services. Kifork is very optimistic, ambitious, and always seeks the best; and this is the reason why he is making a great effort in his professional career to progress and improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en:
Weedor is 35 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest-production rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single with two children, aged 10 and 20 years old, who live at home and are in school.

For six years now, Weedor has been running a beauty salon in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her father and learned this trade from her friends. 

Weedor is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair, hair relaxer, etc. for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair, hair relaxer, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children at their modest house located in one of the beautiful Lebanese villages. Fadi has spent the last sixteen years installing home electricity. He’s the only one covering the family expenses. 

Fadi always wanted to better develop his business and improve his work, but till now he earns a barely fair income, for that reason he decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the needed electrical equipment for his business. He confirms that the loan will help him increase his projects and thus his income by 15%. And as he works independently, he wishes to have his own electrical equipment shop soonest in order to keep on responding to his clients' problems and therefore earn higher revenue.

loans.use: to purchase needed electrical equipment for his business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 37 years old and from Nyandarua South. She is married with seven children who are between the ages of one and 19 years old. 

Rosemary has a grocery business that she has been running for the past 15 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more groceries like potatoes, peas, and vegetables.

She hopes to expand her business and be able to cater to her family well.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, peas, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport in Monrovia and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children, ages 3 and 12, who are attending school and live at home. 

She has been selling palm oil beans, rice, garlic, etc. for the past three years. She says her main challenge is the transportation cost. Esther started this business with money given to her by her father, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money, and what makes her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children. 

Esther is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil beans, rice, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Santilata

texts.en:
Santilata is a 25-year-old widow living with her parents and a child. She has 3 years' experience in the tailoring business. After her husband’s death she opened a tailoring shop at her house and started earning her livelihood and supporting her family. She has one sewing machine currently with which she stitches clothing for the village people.

 She says there is an opportunity for the growth of her business as her shop is the only tailoring shop in the village.  But due to lack of funds she is not able to expand her business. She requires a loan amount of 25,000 INR for purchasing an additional sewing machine and fabrics to meet the demand and make her customers happy.

She hopes to give her child a good education and intends to expand her workplace as much as she can so that she can train some girls from her village and hire them to help create a living for them as well.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a new sewing machine and fabrics for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children. She owns a tea tree farming business, a business which she has been operating for seven years now. She also has an agricultural farm dealing in maize, beans, potatoes, etc. in small scale.

Edda learned about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenge she faces is lack of water.

Edda is applying for a loan of 31,314 Kenyan shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for her business.  The extra funds from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her agricultural business. Her future plan in five years time is to open a cereals shop.

loans.use: buy tea tree seedlings

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a conservative person, she asked her mother to take her place in the photo instead.
Reem has recently turned 18 years old. She is single and is studying hard to be able to get into the university. She has three siblings. Her mother has a knitting business from which she is paying for her and her siblings educational fees. 

Now, Reem is applying for a youth loan to support her mother and buy more wool, so she can increase her productivity and make more scarves, wool hats, and gloves.

loans.use: to buy wool to support her mother's knitting business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 44-year-old man who runs a cafeteria. He has been in the business for four years. He used his previous loan to open another outlet of his business where he sells doughnuts. This brought him more income, which he used to repay his loan and stabilize his new business.
  
He has requested a loan of 20,857 KES to start a salon and a barber shop.

loans.use: To start a barber shop and a salon

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is 38 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad ZDN. She is married with 3 children. To earn a living, Miraflor has a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies. She earns about PHP 3,100 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase feeds and other supplies for hog fattening, her new business. Miraflor has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: To finance for  hog fattening as new business

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 23 years old. He is married and is the father of one child. Alae is the only provider in his family.

Alae is a mechanic who owns a small garage. He established his business in 2011, and now he has an employee. He has gained excellent experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Alae is requesting a loan of $2,400 youth loan to purchase a machine specialized for removing tires as well as to increase his inventory. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a machine specialized for removing tires as well as to increase his inventory

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is a 41-year-old, married man who is a father of four children He is from Bohol, Philippines. 

Efren has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than 15 years now. He also has a farming venture. Efren is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, he will be able to improve his farm's harvest and thus increase his profit. 

In the future, Efren hopes to make his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Aluncia

texts.en:
Aluncia is 37 years old, married, and has 11 children, one of whom is in school.

Aluncia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Aluncia has been farming rice for 10 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Aluncia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

In the future, Aluncia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 42 years old and a widow with 7 children. With 4 children currently going to school, Luisa works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like soap, spices, milk, coffee, etc..
