She has been in this business for 7 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store. In the future Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell, like soap, spices, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his work

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children. The eldest is six years old and the youngest is three years old. She is from Panglao, Bohol. She works in the sari-sari (variety store) business. She has operated her business for five years now and earns PHP 15000 per month. This is the source of her income in supporting the needs of her family.

Gemma is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP to buy additional commodities to sell like medicines, soft drinks, canned goods and soaps. Through this loan, she will be able to take care of the additional needs of her business and meet other expenses.

In the future, Gemma hopes to expand her business. She also wants to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional commodities  to sell like medicines, soft drinks, canned goods and soaps.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en: Marwan is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. He’s a painter and has almost 20 years of experience in this occupation, which has made him well known among people. Marwan is the only source of income for his family, so he works hard to earn higher returns. Marwan is planning to purchase new painting equipment as he wishes to enlarge his business. In this way, he will be able to start new projects on time. This is why he requests a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. today. He’s definitely sure that this step will push him to take on more and bigger projects in the near future and therefore achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase new painting equipment

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en: Shatha is a 21-year-old single lady. Shatha has two brothers and one sister. Her father supports his family from the income that he makes as a taxi driver and from his retirement salary. Shatha is a university student majoring in Nutrition. She has applied for this loan to pay for her next semester registration fees. After graduation she is looking forward to work in her field of study.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester registration fees

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie’s restaurant is located next to the public park in her municipality.  Tessie started her business using an ambulatory cart to carry a basket with the food she cooks to sell at schools and some business establishments.  Tessie works hard in order to grow her business.

Tessie’s hard work has funded her restaurant business as it exists today.  Now, Tessie operates her restaurant business from a stall that she rents. Tessie is striving to reach her dream, which is to own her own stall.  Tessie believes that taking out a loan of 50,000 PHP will help her to quickly realize her dream.  She plans to use the loan to buy meat, other ingredients used in cooking the menu she serves and soft drinks for her restaurant business.  She hopes to increase her income and to have her own stall in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, other ingredients used in cooking the menu she serves and soft drinks.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel, 25 years old, is single. He is currently residing in the house of his parents in the village of San Luis. He has owned and operated a variety store in their village for almost two years. Joel is earning a net income of PHP 3,000 every month. He wants to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase biscuits, noodles, canned goods, sugar, and beverages to sell in his variety store. He's hoping that his requested loan amount will be granted so that he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase biscuits, noodles, canned goods, sugar, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 42 years of age, married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a former OFW in Korea. When her husband was working abroad, Josie invested her remittances from the hog raising business. She is happy that even her husband is not working abroad; they have their hog raising business that serves them as source of income.

Josie has three children sending in school. When they sell their pigs, Josie prioritizes her children expenditures in school and in their household. Now, Josie is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes to continue operating the business while her children attend school. She believes that this loan will help her support her children's needs in school until they have finished their education.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Adoriana

texts.en:
Raising hogs for future sale is Adoriana's primary source of income. She is 54 years old and a widow. She has been in the hog-raising business for seven years now and gains about P2,000 for each hog sold. She would like to improve her sales in order to acquire more profits but has insufficient funds. She is asking for P6,000 to buy feed and vaccines for hogs. 

In the future, Adoriana hopes to keep ensuring the healthy growth of her hogs and to keep developing her income. This will help to save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie, 48, resident of Intramuros Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard to sustain their financial expenses and provide for her family.

Rosalie operates a flower décor business. She just buys the materials and she is the one who makes the flower decoration. She has different designs, so customers have a lot to choose from. This is very in demand, especially for special occasions like anniversaries, birthdays and other gatherings. Her income from sales is PHP 2,100 weekly.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy the materials needed in making a flower decoration like plastic flowers, newspaper, varnish, white glue and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosalie hopes that her business will continue to be successful and that she will have more customers. She dreams of giving her children a good education and a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the materials needed in making a flower decoration like plastic flowers, newspaper, varnish, white glue and other materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more scrap textiles that she will make into rugs. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family. Aside from her rug-making business, she is also a mineral water dealer.

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norma hopes to be successful in her business ventures and dreams of giving her children a quality education and a good life. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* meeting that allows her to give of her own share of God’s love and care in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben's main source of income comes from his corn and coconut production business. He is 29 years old and married with one child. He is from Poblacion, Bonifacio and has been seven years in farming, earning an amount of 3,200 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Arben joined GDMPC. Arben is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and farm chemicals. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and farm chemicals.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe, 57, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Bernardino and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband manages her household and operates her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Fe operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings, when all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and meats costs less than raw food. Fe's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Fe is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Fe dreams to expand her business and to have a variety store. She hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed for her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia. She previously accessed an 45,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She is in this business for nine years now and her store keeps on growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Delia dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies such as grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 45 years old  married with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business, planting & harvesting rice for sale. She's been with her business over four years and  earns  6,500 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is married and has three children. She is 22 years old and resides in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Jelyn is engaged in planting and selling bananas. She's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of business. She is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure for the good growth of her banana. 

In 2011, Jelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Jelyn wants to improve and expand her business in order to increase her return.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
This is Analisa, 38, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a tricycle driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Analisa oversees and owns the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to five passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. She also has a pedicab/sidecar for additional income. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for maintenance on their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams to be able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children and grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for maintenance on their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rayan

texts.en:
Rayan is a 19-year-old engaged woman who has been working for two years as a tutor, to help her fiance buy everything they need for their future house.

Rayan is applying for the first time for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to  buy bed covers and blankets for her future house needs.

Rayan is a hard worker. She is well known in her region for her good reputation; that's why people trust her and allow their children to go to her house and get the requested education.

Rayan is looking forward to her wedding day, and she is also anxious to open a tutoring center where she can accept a lot more students at one time and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy bed covers and blankets for her house

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
This is Pearly, 26, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Rico, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Pearly oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to Pearly. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories, and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Pearly hopes to have more tricycles and dreams of having a baby soon. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
This is Marieta, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a vendor and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marieta operates a bridal gown rental business. She has sewers who she pays to make bridal gowns and then she displays them in her stall so people can see them for rent. She has been in this business for 15 years now. Her regular customers are people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy cloth, fabric, thread, and other materials needed in making a gown. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marieta dreams of expanding her business and having another branch. She hopes to give her children a good education and a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cloth, fabric, thread and other materials needed in making a gown.

loans.name: Inacia

texts.en: Inacia is applying for a loan of $ 1.000 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of a big store near by the main road selling vegetables, fruit, bananas and tomatoes. She is making a good income from selling, and she is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she makes sales every day. She started her business since 2000 with her own working capital of $ 600.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit, bananas, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 67 years old and a widow with three children.

Juanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Juanita has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Juanita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a married and hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Dionisio successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her agricultural business.

NWTF is listing Dionesio's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is 37 years old, married, and has 1 kid in school. Leilani works very hard to provide for them.

Leilani runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leilani has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, snack foods, and school supplies. 

In the future Leilani would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is a 21 years old, married with one child. He lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He operates an agricultural business which is planting, harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community. He's been with his business for one year and earns 2,000 PHP every month. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Federico

texts.en: Federico is a 25-year-old, single man from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He owns and manages a cell phone repair shop in the local community. He's been with his business for one year and earns PHP 1,700 each month. He is a first-time member of the Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). Federico requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase some small phone parts. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase some small phone parts for his cell phone repair business.

loans.name: Leopolda

texts.en: Leopolda is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Leopolda is married and has one child. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. She requests a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her motorcycle so she can offer better service. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lucilita

texts.en:
Lucilita is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy groceries to sell in her store.

Lucilita has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Lucilita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 40 year old woman who is married with four children. For the past four years, she has operated a cattle farm. Sina joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.Sina is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as a wheelbarrow, nails, timber, and wire for her business. She will also purchase uniforms for her kids. Sina plans to use the profit from her loan to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow, nails, timber, and wire

loans.name: Ishaka Iii Group

texts.fr:
Bernard fait partie du groupe  Ishaka  III et   habite à Ngozi. Il  a   42 ans et est marié  à Jacqueline,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  7 enfants,  âgés de  8 mois à 17 ans, dont  4  étudient.

Il fait de l’agriculture et du  commerce de la boisson de banane  depuis  10 ans. 

C'est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer beaucoup de litres de boisson de banane à  vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter une moto  pour son propre déplacement, et voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en:
Bernard is a member of Ishaka III Group and lives in Ngozi. He's 42 years old and married to Jacqueline, a farmer. Together, they have seven children, aged 8 months to 17 years. Out of them, four attend school.

Bernard is a farmer and he's been selling a local beverage made from bananas for then years.

This is his first loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. He intends to use it to bolster his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, in order to make and sell many liters of his banana-based beverage. This will enable him to increase his profits.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to buy a motorcycle for his own transportation, and see his children study.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas to make and sell a local beverage.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 34 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling soft drinks and snacks in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as soft drinks, snacks and cookies. In the future, Julie hopes to save for her children's education and to extend her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to start selling soft drinks, cookies, snacks, and lollies, etc.

loans.name: Peaulele

texts.en: Peaulele is 45 years old and married with five children. She would like to start a small business, selling 'elei' (block printed) materials. In order to do this, Peaulele needs a loan to buy more equipment like paints, clothing materials, spray, a roller, a sketch board, etc. for her business. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy paints, clothing materials, spray, a roller, a sketch board, etc.

loans.name: Remily

texts.en:
Remily is industrious and a good servant of God. She is happily married to a pastor and has two children. Her elder child is working while her younger child is still studying.

Remily has been engaged in the hog raising business. Since she has a lot of hogs to raise, Remily decided to established a retail stall where she offers hog feed for sale within her locality. Remily has been involved in this field of business for three years. With her determination to increase the stocks of hog feed she offers, Remily seized the opportunity to join the program of this lending institution where she could ask for additional capital for her continuous business growth.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 which will allow her to buy 20 bags of hog feed. She knows that through buying stocks of hog feed, she could further economize her fare expenses in going to and from the market. In addition, she will save her time and effort. 

Remily believes that through this kind of business she could let her younger child finish her studies and be able to have a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of hog feed for her retail stall

loans.name: Fia

texts.en: Fia is 60 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business preparing and selling raw fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy equipment such as fishing rods, nets, a canoe, etc. In the future, Fia hopes to save for her children's education and for her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing rods, fishing net, a canoe, and other fishing gear.

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en: Iuni is 32 years old and married with one child. She would like to start a small business, selling 'elei' (block printed) materials such as dresses and others. In order to do this, Iuni needs a loan to buy new equipment like paints, clothing materials, spray, a roller, a sketch board, etc. for her 'elei' designs. She hopes to use her profits to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy paints, clothing materials, spray, a roller, a sketch board, etc

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband continuously working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary hopes that the lives of her family will be better and dreams that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

In the future, Mariana hopes to save for her family's betterment and her children's education. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 63-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 8 children. The oldest child is 37 while the youngest is 10 years old.

She is engaged in farming. She has grown rice for 20 years. Her husband is also a farmer, which is the source of the family's livelihood. Imelda requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional pesticides and medicines fora  better harvest so she could sell it on time.

In the future, Imelda would like to invest in other ventures to support her family as well as to save for the preparation of their old age.

loans.use: to buy additional pesticides and medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fai

texts.en:
Fai is 57 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, yam and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Fai needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed spray, a file and knives for her plantation. Fai will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed spray, chainsaw, knives, etc.

loans.name: Toe

texts.en:
Toe is 24 years old, not married and has no children. She would like to start a small business selling ready-made clothes in her community. 

In order to do this, Toe needs a loan to buy paints, clothing materials, spray, roller, sketch board, etc., for her business. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy paints, clothing materials, spray, roller, sketch board, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Guilermo and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan offers manicure and pedicure services. She already has regular customers in her community and they contact her when they need her. She does home service. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy nail polish, cuticle remover, pusher, nail cutters and other materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susan dreams that her child will finish his college and hopes to have more business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials and products needed in manicure and pedicure like nail polish, nail polish remover, cuticle remover, nail cutter, nail file and other products.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a 36-year-old married man and a father of two young children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. 

Jorge is engaged in a tricycle transport business and has been in the business for more than six years now. This is the source of his income.

Jorge is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the tricycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the tricycle.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 38 years of age, married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), and has three children. Since her spouse works abroad, she stands as both father and mother to her three children. She has been running her variety store for ten years. With her determination to help her spouse in generating income, she aspires to increase the volume of merchandise she offers to her local community. She is thankful to God because, despite her situation as a temporary single parent, she is still able to manage her business and family well.

Marites wants to expand her business, so she is requesting additional capital of PHP12,000. She will use this loan amount to buy volumes of merchandise to improve her general store, such as cases of soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, instant noodles and some ingredients. She hopes that through this requested loan amount, she can further expand her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy volumes of merchandise to improve her general store, such as cases of soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, instant noodles and some ingredients.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina’s goal in life is to uplift their family's quality of life. Cristina’s children are all attending school. Her husband is working abroad as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). 

Cristina manages a livestock business in their village. Some of her husband's monthly remittances for their children's allowance in school went for hog feed.

With her determination to help her husband in fulfilling their needs, Cristina also engages in a direct selling business of shoes and ready-to-wear clothes for additional sources of income. 

In this connection, Cristina wants to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to pay for products for her direct selling business. She hopes to purchase more products to allow her costumers a chance to choose what they want. With the income, she will be able to provide her hogs feed.

loans.use: to purchase products for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en:
Yucabeth is a forty-three-year-old lady. She is married to Innocent and they are blessed with four children. She sells GNLD products ("Golden Neo Life Dynamite" for personal and home care products) and has been in business for eight years. She gets a monthly income of about forty thousand shillings.

This will be Yucabeth's third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of GNLD cleaning products to supply hotels. She plans to plow the profits back into her business. In the future she hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of GNLD cleaning products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 30 years old and a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and five children, four of whom are schooling. Nelly has been farming for the past five years, producing milk, maize and beans which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 52,000 KES loan from Juhudi kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that will provide her with more milk to sell. It will earn her extra income which she will use to uplift her living standards, and she will use some of the money to pay for her children’s schooling. She aspires to have four dairy cows in the next five years. Diseases, competition and the fluctuation of prices are her major challenges in farming. 

Nelly is very thankful to Juhudi kilimo for financing her with the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the products needed in her variety store. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. Her loan also helped in the education of their children.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn dreams of giving her children a good quality education and hopes that her business will expand even more. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 28-year-old businessman. He is married to Monica who is a mixed crop farmer, and their marriage is blessed with two children, ages five and two. Samuel has been running a retail shop as his primary business and a barber shop as his secondary business, but he also gets support from his wife’s mixed crop farming business. From these combined businesses the family is able to raise a monthly income of about KES 60,000, which is used to support the family. 

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Samuel will use the loan to buy sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps and cooking fat for his retail shop, and some of the money will be used in preparing his land for farming. With the anticipated profit from his businesses he intends to start a wholesale shop. 

Samuel hopes to buy a big piece of land for large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps and cooking fat, and for preparing his farmland.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is a 53-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Beauty has requested a loan to purchase more equipment and chemicals to expand her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Beauty hopes to save for home improvements.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knife, shovels and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en: Ma. Delia is a fish vendor from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of her income. Ma. Delia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a sixty-three-year-old lady. She is single and blessed with three children who are all adults. Mary started selling charcoal due to the demand of her customers, as she is a wholesale grocery supplier. She also has rental houses. She has been in business for twenty years and gets a monthly income of about KES 70,000.

This will be Mary's fourth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase sixty bags of charcoal and to renovate her rental houses. In the future she hopes to own more rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase sixty bags of charcoal and to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cristina dreams that her children will grow well and hopes that her business will expand even more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 52 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the small village of Bagdati district with her husband, son, and daughter-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business. They have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production.They also have a vineyard with 500 samples of vine trees and 0.6 hectare of agricultural land, where maize is grown. They sell the harvested maize, wine, and cheese locally at a good price. 

Mzia is requesting a loan for cultivating the land.  After the land is cultivated, she will be able to sow maize, which will increase the income of the family and to improve their living conditions. Mzia is a very hard working woman and has a rich experience in her business.

loans.use: to cultivate the land

loans.name: Highton

texts.en:
Highton is a 61-year-old married man who is blessed with five children who live with them. He is very hard-working and is always setting a good example at home, as every morning he wakes up with new dreams and desires for prospering. He owns a cereals shop, where he sell basic commodities such as peas, maize, beans, millet, sorghum and other seasonal cereals at a retail price.

He has been doing this for the last 10 years thanks to his patience and desire to achieve his goals in life. He has therefore gained a wide variety of customers, hence the need to expand his business and buy sacks of beans, maize and peas. It is for this reason that he has requested a loan amounting to 40,000 Kenyans shillings. He is grateful to all for this great opportunity.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy sacks of beans, maize and peas.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a 38-year-old business lady. She is married to Daniel, and they are blessed with three children who are in school. She has been practicing mixed farming -- that is poultry farming and dairy farming as well crop farming -- for the past 10 years. She earns an approximate income of 80,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from the three businesses. 

Karen is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy poultry feeds and dairy feeds. With the anticipated profit from her businesses, she intends to venture into large-scale poultry farming. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be a large-scale farmer in poultry and dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and dairy feeds.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 27 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She lives with them and her husband. She is very hard-working and is always a good example to the young generation of the community, as she has had lots of struggles to ensure ends meet. She wakes up with new dreams and desires for prospering. 

She owns a general shop where she sells home-based goodies including wheat and maize flour, tissue paper, bread, milk and eggs, among other things. She has been doing this for the last two years, therefore giving her a reasonable number of customers thanks to her joyful way of serving her customers and experience gained from running day-to-day activities. Hence, she needs to expand her business. 

Everline has been a Yehu member for the last two years. She has therefore approached us with a loan request amounting to 10,000 Kenyan shillings to help her stock the shop and buy both maize and wheat flour, crates of eggs and dozen of tissues. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: to help her stock the shop and buy both maize and wheat flour, crates of eggs and dozen of tissues.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is a 38-year-old woman, divorced, with two children. She is a market vendor and has sold women's clothes for the last three years. 

She started her business because her husband left her without daily bread and he was not helping her after divorce. Now she rents a place on the central bazaar and her monthly income is AZN 130. Her older son helps her to sell clothes. 

Guldasta knows the taste of her customers very well and that’s why her business is successful. She applied for a loan of AZN 1500 to purchase clothes for the upcoming spring season. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell for the spring season.

loans.name: Mbyuta

texts.en: Mbyuta is a 28-year-old married lady. She lives together with her husband, to whom she was married nine years ago, and four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a salon that she has been running for the last two years, since she completed her six-month training on hair treatment. She has been using her friend’s materials. This is why she has approached to us for a loan of KES 10,000, so she can buy a blow drier, a basin and chemicals. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a blow drier, a basin and chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a 47-year-old businessman. He is married to Purity, and they have five children who are in school. He has been selling second-hand clothes for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,500, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy a larger stock of second-hand clothes to sell. He intends to plow the anticipated income  back into the business. Isaac’s hopes and dreams are to expand his business and to buy a piece of land for his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more glass for making windows and aquariums.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady est une femme qui vend des denrées alimentaires devant son domicile au bord de la route.Elle est mariée et utilise les revenus tirés de son commerce pour entretenir ses enfants et satisfaire ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter du 5 sacs de mil qu'elle va stocker et revendre lorsque les prix vont monter.Elle ambitionne de construire une cantine au marché de son village.
texts.en: Khady is a merchant who sells food in front of her home, at the side of the road. She is married and uses the income she earns to support her children and to meet her own daily needs. With the goal of expanding her business, Khady is requesting a loan of 250,000 XOF to purchase five sacks of millet that she plans to store and resell when prices increase. Khady's goal is to build a canteen at the village market.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of millet

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn, from Bohol, Philippines, is a married woman and the mother of four children. She earns a living through from her sari-sari or variety store, selling various goods to the people of her community. Roselyn is applying for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, candies, rice, soda and other beverages, and electronic loads. With this loan, she will be able to attract and serve more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and her income. Roselyn dreams of expanding her business and making it a success in the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her sari sari store, such as canned goods, candies, rice, soda and other beverages, and electronic loads.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 49-year-old married lady who lives with her husband and her four children, ages 18, 16, 12, and 8, all of whom are still in school. She is a hard-working businesswoman who owns a grocery store in which she sells green goods, such as vegetables, onions, tomatoes and cabbage. She has been running this business for many years and has gained great sales experience, which has helped her increase her customer base and her income range, and to find better ways of servicing her customers’ needs. The grocery store is located near her home. She has many regular customers who prefer to shop in her store because she always has the products they need at affordable prices, fresh and green, and she provides excellent service.
Veronica is very dedicated to her work. She is energetic, and she has many goals for the future. Her secret of success is consistency and a love of her work. With these two things, she believes that anyone can achieve what they desire. She has applied for a loan of KES 50,000 to help her expand her grocery store to include cereals, and to buy sacks of peas, beans and maize.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store to include cereals, and to buy sacks of peas, beans and maize.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is a 55-year-old, married woman, with one daughter. She breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle to local butchers for meat. Nazila has more than ten years of experience in this field, thanks to her father who taught her well how to look after cattle.

Nazila usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yogurt she sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat-selling brings AZN 150 income per month. 

Milk and yogurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma and always use yogurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is only one financial income. Nazila applied for a loan of AZN 1,000 to purchase one milk cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un homme marié, père de deux enfants dont l'un fréquente l'école.Il exerce comme meunier au marché du village.Afin d'augmenter ses revenus, il pratique en même temps l'embouche bovine.Ces deux activités lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 400 000f pour acheter deux bœufs.Son ambition est d'acheter une second moulin à mil.
texts.en: Abdoulaye is a married father of two children, one of whom attends school. He works as the miller in the local village market. In order to increase his earnings, Abdoulaye has a second source of income fattening bovine for resale. These two businesses allow him to maintain the daily expenses of his family. Abdoulaye is currently seeking a loan of 400,000 XOF so that he can buy two steers. His goal is to purchase a second millet mill.

loans.use: to purchase two steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings.

loans.name: Aminata Samba

texts.fr:
Aminata Samba, 48 ans est mère de 6 enfants dont le plus âgé a 27 ans et le cadet, 10 ans. Elle fait de l’embouche depuis maintenant 3 ans.
Elle est à son second crédit et demande un montant de 250000F CFA pour acheter des bœufs, élever et revendre. Elle aide son époux en participant à la dépense quotidienne.
Puisque son fond n’est pas consistant, elle élève par un ou deux bœufs. Maintenant, avec le crédit, elle pourra augmenter le nombre de tête. Elle désire un jour avoir sa propre ferme agricole pour diversifier son activité : y faire de l’embouche aussi bien du maraichage.
texts.en:
Aminata Samba is 48 years old and the mother of six children. The eldest is 27 years old and the youngest is ten. Aminata Samba has been raising cattle for the past three years. Aminata Samba is on her second loan cycle, and is currently seeking a loan of 250,000 XOF. She plans to use this loan to buy cattle, which she will then raise and resell. Aminata Samba helps her husband to pay for their daily expenses.

Since Aminata Samba did not have consistent funding in the past, she was only able to raise one or two steers. Now, with her loan, Aminata Samba can increase the number of cattle she can afford to raise. She wants to one day have her own farm so that she can diversify her agricultural business. Aminata Samba would use her farm to raise cattle, as well as to grow produce to sell in the market.

loans.use: to purchase cattle that she will raise and resell.

loans.name: Safarli

texts.en:
Safarli, a 47-year-old pensioner, is a married father of three children. He breeds cattle and sells their meat to local butchers right from his home. Safarli has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle.

Safarli usually buys small cattle, raising and fattening them in five-six months, reselling them for profit at the local livestock bazaar. People use beef in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Meat-selling earns him 150 AZN per month.

This is the only source of income in his family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Safarli has therefore applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase three more head of cattle. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 38 лет, замужем. У них с мужем двое замечательных детей. Бактыгул имеет высшее образование по характеру очень жизнерадостная и неунывающая позитивная женщина. С 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 KGS с приобретения 1 коровы. Дополнительно Бактыгуль иногда привозит вещи из Бишкека и продает в магазины. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход от животноводства составляет 10,000 KGS.В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и сена.Тем самым она сможет увеличить свои доходы от молочной деятельности. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины и построить дом сыну.
texts.en: Baktygul is 38 years old, she is married. She and her husband have two wonderful children. Baktygul has a high education and has a very happy and cheerful, positive personality. Since 1990 she has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation, a business which she started with 20,000 KGS by buying one cow. Additionally Baktygul sometimes brings in clothing from Bishkek and sells to the stores. Thanks to her hard work Baktygul now has two milk cows, two calves and two horses in her livestock. Her monthly income from animal husbandry is 10,000 KGS. With the goal to grow her business she has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow and fodder. By that she can increase her income from the dairy business. Baktygul plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock and build a house for her son.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигуль жительница района Вахш. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и воспитывает двоих детей. Рузигуль очень трудолюбивая женщина и наравне с мужем обеспечивает семью. Она занимается растениеводством уже 7 лет. Она выращивает клубнику и после сбора урожая поставляет на рынки. Рузигуль запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Она хочет увеличить урожай клубники и теперь поставлять его другим государствам.
texts.en:
Ruzigul is a resident of the Vakhsh region. She is 43 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Ruzigul is a very hardworking woman and along with her husband provides for the family. She has been engaged in agriculture for seven years. She grows strawberries and after the harvest takes them to the markets. 

Ruzigul is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. She wants to increase her strawberry harvest and then to supply other states as well.

loans.use: to acquire mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru:
Хикоят очень добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Хикоят благодаря своим родителям получила высшее образование и более 2 лет работает учительницей в средней школе. Она получает маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения 4 детей. Она должна найти новый источник дохода и поэтому она решила организовать свой бизнес скотоводством.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От данного курса она получила много информаций об организации бизнеса. Хикоят написала свой бизнес план, и она готово начать бизнес, но только у нее нет денег для покупки скота для своего бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hikoyat is a very kind and determined woman. She is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. Thanks to her parents, Hikoyat received a higher education and worked for more than two years as a teacher in a high school. She receives a small salary which is not enough to care for four children. She had to find a new source of income, and therefore decided to organize her own livestock она ре business.

To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. From the training, she received a lot of information about starting a business. Hikoyat wrote a business plan, and she is ready to start a business, but she only lacks money to buy livestock for the business. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy livestock in order to establish a new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Shafa

texts.en:
Shafa is a 39-year-old man, married, with two sons. He sells seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, bananas, onions, potatoes, and cabbages. Shafa has 12 years of experience in this field and he has gained necessary skills and knowledge required for his business.
 
Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and are in high demand during the year. People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. 

Shafa's shop is located in the center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits. His monthly income from this business is AZN 150. Shafa's wife helps him to sell fruits.

Shafa wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as to improve the lives of his family. For these purposes, he applied for an AZN 1,000 loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru:
Мукарам жительница города Вахдат. Ей 49 лет. Мукарам разведена и одна обеспечивает семью. Она зарабатывает на жизнь вышиванием национальных одежд. Она работает портнихой уже 3 года. Сегодня это прибыльное дело.
Мукарам хочет расширить свою деятельность. Она берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машины и с помощью ее улучшить процесс своей работы.
texts.en:
Mukaram is a resident of the town of Vahdat. She is 49 years old. Mukaram is divorced and takes care of her family on her own. She makes a living by embroidering national clothing. She has been working as a seamstress for three years. Today, it is profitable work.

Mukaram wants to expand her activities. She is taking out a loan to purchase a new sewing machine and to use it to improve the process of her work.

loans.use: to acquire a sewing machine

loans.name: Lakisa

texts.en:
Lakisa is now 45 years old, and she is still hardworking, the mother of four children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal continues to be to educate her children.

She has been a clothes dealer for the last 26 years. After starting with initial capital in the amount of 100,000 UGX, she now has over 4 million UGX. Her major challenge has been insufficient capital to purchase stock; however, she has a vision of expanding her business into new areas.

Lakisa used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. Lakisa is now seeking a loan to buy additional clothes to sell.

loans.use: to expand and improve her retail business by purchasing additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina de 45 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad de 17, 7 años están estudiando. Originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de país. Sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche y sus derivados, queso, cuajada crema, leche agria. En sus ratos libre le gusta cocinar comida típica para sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria. Pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser veterinaria.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosmético y prendas de oro laminado, como rubor, vanidad, sombra de ojos, lápiz de ojos, lápiz labial, crema de cuerpos, perfumes. Tiene mas de seis años en este negocio el cual lo desempeña de forma ambulante. La rutina de Carolina es trabajar unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. En la foto se muestra a carolina mostrando el producto que comercializa. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra  y venta de productos cosméticos. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Carolina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Carolina is 45-years old and a single mother with two minor children -- 17 and 7 years -- who are studying.  She hails from El Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the country.  Sauce is characterized as an area that produces milk and dairy products, cheese, curd, and buttermilk.

In her free time, she likes to cook traditional foods for her children.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was not able to go to college, though she would have liked very much to be a veterinarian.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has as her economic activity a sales business of gold-plated jewelry and cosmetics, such as blush, compacts, eye shadow, eye pencils, lip pencils, body cream and perfumes.  She has been in this business for more than six years, and sells door-to-door.

Carolina's routine is to work 8 hours daily, offering her products to regular and occasional customers.  She carries out this activity with great pleasure, as it has been her way of life and that of her family.  The photo shows Carolina displaying the products she sells.

She hopes that in the not-too distant future, she can earn a better income.  Carolina appreciates the help that Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they have a means of respectable work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and diversify her cosmetics sales business by purchasing products such as blush, compacts, eye shadow, eye pencils, lip pencils, body cream and perfumes.

loans.name: Museyib

texts.en:
Museyib is a 56-year-old, married man with four children.

He runs a furniture workshop in his home city. Specifically, most of the furniture he makes is from natural wood. He explains that he has 26 years of experience in this field and many customers. He believes that he has so many customers because he always complete orders on time and provides high-quality furniture. His monthly income is approximately 120 AZN.

While Museyib's customers have placed many orders, he has insufficient materials to complete the orders at this time. In fact, he is unable to purchase such materials at this time because many of his customers prefer to pay after his work is done. As a result, Museyib is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN to purchase additional raw materials. This would be his second loan, and he notes that he a good history of repaying his loans.

loans.use: to complete customers' orders by purchasing additional raw (wood) materials

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a married man from Jabalia. He is the father of five children: two sons and three daughters.

He is employed, but earns very low wages. Bassam would like to improve the living conditions for his family, so he would like to earn additional income by working as a taxi driver.

Bassam explains that he has a car but that it needs vehicle mats, a license, and an insurance policy for taxi services. As a result, Bassam is seeking a $1,000 loan from FATEN, which would help Bassam prepare his car so that it could operate as a legal taxi. Bassam appears in the photo beside his car.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle mats, insure his car, and secure a taxi license

loans.name: Kulbayra

texts.ru: На сегодняшний день, ее хозяйство с коровами и баранами приносит около 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулбайра обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы Кулбара планирует вложить в образование детей.
texts.en: Today, her farm with cows and sheep brings in about 17,000 som (KGS) a month from the sale of milk and dairy products. In order to further develop her business, Kulbayra appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow. Kulbayra plans to invest income in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase one diary cow

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia, de 43 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de Félix su esposo desde hace 22 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos, que son menores de edad y a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia, pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, los que ya mayores siguieron su camino. Ahora sigue trabajando para el futuro de los menores, por ello trabaja con ahínco y esmero. Su actividad económica es la agricultura, siembra alverja, maíz y papa en sus propios terrenos; según cuenta tiene un promedio de 2 parcelas, que en cada cosecha vende al menudeo en el mercado de la ciudad de Pampas, donde trabaja una vez a la semana. Pues en el resto de los días, viaja a la selva, donde tiene plantaciones de plátanos; que cuida su hijo, quien vive ahí. Pero como es una mujer con iniciativa, también cría gallina y ovejas, los cuales enseba para después venderlos a un mayor precio, asimismo comenzó con la venta de golosinas en la plaza de su localidad, ya que así obtiene un ingreso adicional para el hogar. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Teodocia, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos; ya que piensa sembrar en gran cantidad.
texts.en:
Teodocia is a tenacious 43-year old woman. She has been living with her husband, Félix, for 22 years, and together they have seven children, three of which are minors and live with them in the house that she inherited from her parents. Thanks to her efforts and perseverance, she has been able to provide for her children. The oldest ones have followed their paths, but she still works hard and with great care for the future of her youngest kids. 

She works in agriculture cultivating peas, corn and potatoes in her own fields. According to her, she has an average of two plots and sells retail at the market of Pampas city, where she goes once a week. On other days, she goes to the rain-forest, where she has banana plantations, and takes care of her son living there. However, given that she's an enterprising woman, she also breeds hens and sheep to sell them at a higher price, and sells candy at the town square to have an extra income for the house. 

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very pleased to count on this financial support. She has always been compliant with her payments and likes to be part of her association, where all members are supportive and responsible. Teodocia plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to be scattered over her fields, as she plans to cultivate on large scale.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to be scattered over her fields, as she plans to cultivate on large scale.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en:
Ikhlas is 19 years old  and single.  She is from Jabalia. Her father works in a gas station earning a low income, which barely covers the family's expenses and needs. 

Ikhlas is requesting a loan from FATEN for $500, which she will use to buy a new laptop to help her in her university studies. 

Ikhlas is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her father appears in her Kiva photo.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 31-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest child is four years old, while the youngest is two. 

Ana Marie engages in a buy-and-sell business. She sells assorted kitchen utensils and home materials. She has been in the buy-and-sell business for five  years. Her husband is also engaged in the buy-and-sell business. 

Ana Marie requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy piglets and to create additional capital to purchase in bulk, assorted kitchen utensils and home materials, to avoid the stock shortage. In the future, Ana Marie would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and to create additional capital to purchase assorted kitchen utensils and home materials for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 41-year-old married lady with four kids aged 13, 11, 9 and 7. She lives together with her children and her husband in their house in Msambweni, Kenya, which was built six years ago.

Her greatest expenditure is shopping since few people do farming; hence food tends to be expensive. Being a  farmer, she has the capability to reduce the cost of food by improving her produce. It is for this reason that Christine has approached Yehu with a loan request amounting to KES 30,000 so as to  buy fertilizer and seeds as planting season is approaching.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds as planting season is approaching.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 49 years old and divorced. She lives with her old mother and brother. Farida has been breeding cattle for the last 10 years. She was a housewife, and now she is on pension. 

Farida usually buys small calves, raises them, and fattens them for 5-6 months. She then resells them for a profitable price at the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 120 AZN, and this business is the only source of income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Farida also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase two cows, one milking cow, and some fodder.  This will be her third loan, and she has good credit history.

loans.use: To buy two cows, one milking cow, and some fodder

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 53 years old, and a business lady. She is still practicing mixed crop farming as her primary business, and for the past one and half years with a monthly income of KES 50,000 which she uses to support her family. Lucy is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

She is very happy and grateful to KADET LTD and Kiva Lenders for the financial support. She made a profit out of her business, added savings she had accumulated, and she was able to start a retail shop, which is doing well.  

She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar and stationery as stock for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business she will empower her children with education. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and stationery as stock for her shop.

loans.name: Pedro Jesus

texts.es:
Pedro de 59 años de edad, originario de la Comarca Asedades,  localizado en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de 6 hijos, 2 de ellos entre las edades de 9 y 4 años, están a su cargo y los otros 4 ya son independiente de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, trigo y frijoles. Inicio su actividad laboral a la edad de  15 años,  empezó a trabajar  con otros agricultores, desde muy pequeño, luego decidió trabajar por si solo sembrando maíz, frijoles para el consumo propio y para vender a sus clientes, este ha sido su única actividad. Cuenta con otros ingresos  provenientes de las ventas de sus cuajadas, ya que con las ganancias de su siembra y de la venta de sus cuajadas ha podido comprar más ganado y tierras, el  comercializar sus productos en la misma zona para evitar gastos, sus expectativas es seguir creciendo con las ventas  en su negocio.
Solicita el financiamiento para la compra de semilla de maíz, trigo, frijoles y todos los insumos necesarios para su siembra como abono, fertilizantes, y  pagar mano de obra en su siembra con el objetivo de obtener mejor rendimiento en su cosecha, el estima que el préstamo le ayudara porque no tendría que vender sus animales, también compraría sus insumos anticipados para preparar mejor la siembra y obtener mejores resultados, sus planes futuros es seguir comprando nuevos lotes de tierras para seguir ampliando el área de su siembra.
texts.en:
Pedro, 59, is from the Asedades region, located on the outskirts of Teustepe.  He's married and the father of six children.  Two of them, between the ages of 9 and 4, are in his care; the other four are already independent.

He works as a farmer, making a living growing corn, wheat, and beans.  He started his business at the age of 15.  He began working with other farmers at a very young age, then decided to work by himself, growing corn and beans for his own consumption and to sell to his customers.  This has been his only job.

He has other income from selling his curd cheese.  With the profits from his crop and the sale of his cheeses he has been able to buy more livestock and land.  He sells his products in the same area to avoid costs.  His expectation is to continue growing with the sales in his business.

He's requesting the loan to buy corn, wheat, and bean seeds, and all the supplies he needs for planting, such as manure and fertilizer, and to pay for labor for his land so he can get a better yield from his crop.  He thinks the loan will help him because he would not have to sell his animals.  He'll also buy the supplies he anticipates needing to better prepare the field and to get better results.

His plan for the future is to continue buying plots of land to continue expanding the area of his cultivated land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es: El señor Orlando habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe en el  Barrio El Eden, su esposa le apoya en todas sus decisiones, el trabaja la tierra desde muy pequeño, con este credito podra darle Mantenimiento a su cultivo de Piña y podra asi obtener una buena cosecha. comprara. Fertilizantes, completo, Urea etc. Agradece el apoyo por parte de Afodenic y Fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
Orlando lives in the town of Ticuantepe, in the El Eden neighborhood.  His wife supports him in all of their decisions.  He has worked the land since he was very young.

With this loan, he will be able to provide maintenance and upkeep to his pineapple crop and will thereby be able to have a good harvest.  He will buy rich fertilizers, urea. etc.  

He is thankful for the support of Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to maintain his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
